review.title: Great hotel within a stone's throw of Union Square
review.reviewText: We booked a deluxe room with a king bed and were not disappointed with the room size or its facilities. The bed was enormously wide. Room furniture was good and in keeping with the period feel of the hotel. I suppose that the biggest drawback is the lack of breakfast and although the hotel has a connecting restaurant we were never asked to dine there. Instead, we took all of our meal's at outside establishments - there's a great Lori's diner just around the corner. Back at the hotel, late afternoon tea and sherry in the Lobby was most welcome. And early morning coffee was available on two of the higher floors. In room coffee-making facilities were replenished every day. Our bathroom had a large walk-in shower and we were provided with lots of toiletries. All in all, it was a great place for two 60 year olds to stay, close to all of the action, transport links and the Cheesecake Factory in Macy's.
review.positiveRemarks: The sherry! And the pianist has to be heard!
review.negativeRemarks: Doubles as an entrance for the theatre. The lift can be in use for folks other than hotel guests.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to the cable car but usually huge queues. Consider going to bottom of California St instead. Take the F car from Powell to Pier 39.

review.title: Close to Union Swuare
review.reviewText: Great location. Dated hotel. Limited service bins not emptied beds roughly made. Check in staff friendly. Concierge provided wrong local information. Recommended shuttle did not turn up. Rescheduled 45 minutes later lucky to catch plane. Tea and sherry in lobby was nice.

review.title: Well situated hotel
review.reviewText:
We spent 4 nights staying here while visiting San Francisco. Great location for being able to get to the main attractions in the city. 

There was no air con, but when we visited in the middle of summer this wasn't necessary.

We came by car. The hotel does valet parking, but there are plenty of other more cost effective options nearby, but I'd recommend you book these in advance.
review.negativeRemarks: More facilities like a restaurant, bar and a larger lounge would be nice
review.locationRemarks: Very well located in the centre of San Francisco, right next to Union Square

review.title: Nice hotel, close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Great hotel, nice and clean eith informative and helpful staff. Close to union square, the cable car and all the tourist spots of central San Francisco as well as shopping. Lots to do see and plenty of places to eat all close by.

review.title: Beautiful hotel next to Union Square
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with friendly, helpful staff. Right next to Union Square and the financial district. Easy to get around and close to many attractions, bars, spots to eat.

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: A hotel with real character in a great location.  Ideal for exploring the city and lots of good places to eat and drink nearby.

review.title: "Personality" is a euphemism
review.reviewText: So...this hotel looks great online. Don't fall for it. It has not been renovated in at least 25 years. And -- there is no AC! You need to rely on opening your window (and it's the middle of the city, so it gets noisy), and a ceiling fan. Yes, I know many in San Francisco don't have AC, but for the same price, you can stay one block up the street at the JW Marriott, which is exactly what I did after the first night. Furniture is old and worn out, and the bathroom is very poorly designed.
review.negativeRemarks: Renovate the entire hotel from top to bottom.
review.locationRemarks: Only a block from Union Square.

review.title: Nice hotel 10-20 minutes away from attractions.
review.reviewText: Not a bad place to stay. The hotel is a bit older, so don't expect anything too fancy. The view we had of the city was great from our room. Uber/Lyft rides were about 10-20 minutes away from all the major attractions. A short walk away from union square. Surrounded by many places to eat. Overall, pretty satisfied.

review.title: Fantastic location, but dated hotel
review.reviewText:
Stayed here for 4 nights in August 16 on top floor
Have no issue with the location and stuff services of the hotel, they are wonderful.
However the hotel is really old and noise insulation is quite poor.
We got the double queen beds room, however the room is still quite small, the bathroom was newly renovated, however the water pressure and temperature of the shower was so unstable.
review.positiveRemarks: location, some personal touches and service of stuff
review.negativeRemarks: Noise insulation, upgrade/renovation
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to everything you need.

review.title: Nice hotel in union square
review.reviewText: The staff were friendly and very helpful and the hotel is in a great location. We practically walked everywhere. The room was very spacious and clean.

Mario, was charmimg, and gave us a history of the hotel and the area. 
The hotel is historic and well maintained, very comfortable, clean and quiet, and walking distance to Union Square. 
Excellent tea in the Lobby in am, and coffee offered on floors 9 and 11.
review.positiveRemarks: quiet,clean, helpful staff, walking distance to Union Square for shopping, close to Apple store, walking distance to Museum of Modern Art (MOMA).
review.negativeRemarks: One elevator was out of order, elevator was a bit slow, but acceptable. There could be a small exercise room with an elliptical , treadmill, bike.
review.locationRemarks:
As above, great location for walking to Union 
Sq,, Theater District, MOMA, Yerba Buena Center.

review.title: Great location with walking to Union Square
review.reviewText: Lovely SF boutique hotel. Helpful and friendly staff and good service. Room was nice, clean and with adequate amenities. Quiet even though it is in the hub of the city. Walking to Union Square, shopping, cable cars, good restaurants. Not fancy but charming. Coffee and sherry in the evening, coffee in the morning as well as in-room. Good beds. Windows can be partially opened for fresh air.
review.negativeRemarks: elevator was down to just one function
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel was excellent.  You could catch the Cable Car right on the corner. 
Many restaurants nicely located at many different price points. It was an older hotel but it has very well kept.
The room was great and conveniently located! Friendly staff. The valet stole money out of our car but the hotel itself was excellent.

review.title: Nice old hotel, needs updating
review.reviewText: Good union square location. A once beautiful old hotel. Has not been updated. Rooms are very small. No onsite parking, No A/C in room. We slept with windows open and were comfortable as far as temperature but the noise of the city was overwhelming.  The beds are well used. There are other hotels in same price range that offer full amenities.

review.title: heart of financial district, great location.
review.reviewText: walking distance/short ride to everything. valet parking way cheaper than Chicago hotels. Excellent hotel, uber friendly staff.

review.title: FRAUDULENT CHARGES ON MY CREDIT CARD AFTER MY STAY
review.reviewText: My mother and I stayed at the hotel a few weeks back.  I used my credit card to pay for the hotel and it was the only time I gave my card or used the card during the entire trip.  We received a call from our credit card company that several charges had been made in the area (Kmart, etc. places I never patronize) with our card number.  Clearly this hotel doesn't have the necessary financial security measures as this is the only place that could have used my number to charge at other merchants.  Pretty disappointing on a hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: It's an old hotel with very little staff, but the location is great and the rooms are clean.

review.reviewText: Very convenience to access tour location, the staff are very friendly, the room service also was very nice. I definitely recommend my friend this hotel to stay.

review.title: Great location - friendly staff
review.reviewText: Everyone that worked there was super friendly and helpful! While the hotel room itself was not as large as a new modern hotel, it had character and was super clean! Down to the fancy bench in the beautiful elevator - we loved everything about our stay!!!

review.title: Good location in the middle of union square
review.reviewText: Hotel is centrally located; close to shopping. Hotel staff is very accommodating.

review.title: Very nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: I enjoyed staying at this hotel as the staff were very friendly, attentive & professional.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were clean, spacious & had a bar refrigerator which was handy.  The beds were very comfortable & large.
review.negativeRemarks: The reception of the tv was not great.  I had to switch rooms during my stay & my second room did not have a bar refrigerator.
review.locationRemarks: The location was very convenient; close to Union Square, public transportation, shopping, restaurants & the area felt very safe.

review.title: Convenient but a bit cramped
review.reviewText: This hotel is just one half block from Union Square, with tour bus pick ups and public transportation close by.  We found it to be well located for exploring the city.  We were, however, disappointed in the size of the room, which felt cramped, and in the small main lobby.          The weather during our stay was not great,  but this hotel offers no bar and little public space for waiting out the drizzle.
My boyfriend and I were very pleased this pas weekend. Thank you so much for a comfortable and enjoyable stay.

review.title: Just okay.!
review.reviewText: Well the hotel was located in the centre of city and close to shopping and restaurant..! It does not have its own dining menu..! It's a historic building and most of the things are pretty old.! Wifi was good..! Complimentary tea and coffee in morning and evening..! Room was not very clean.! Attentive and helpful staff..! Overall experience was good.!

review.title: Good location but hotel not what I was expecting
review.reviewText: This place had higher ratings than another botique hotel I usually stay at but I think I'd rather stay elsewhere next time. There are no bell boys so be ready to take your bags in yourself. The building is old and not updated, and the room was small with ugly old fixtures in the bathroom. It's a great location but there are several other nearby hotels much nicer around the same range or $20 more.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: The hotel is a nice size and the staff are really friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: As an older hotel it has character,and sherry and tea in the lobby at night was different
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing major stands out.
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to Union Square and the main shopping areas.

review.title: Great location, but stinky
review.reviewText: Wonderful location and overall the hotel is nice, despite the fact that the building is older. However I had a horrible smell on my floor (7th), which got eventually into the room. I guess it's the restaurant next to them, I could definitely tell what's cooking, especially when they cooked the fish.

review.title: Hotel showing signs of age
review.reviewText: Mostly this hotel was great, especially with Expedia pricing. However our first room had a broken heating unit (heating our room when it was 85 degrees outside) and a broken ceiling fan. Once we changed rooms we were much more comfortable. I will say though that the showers were really inconsistent in both water pressure (either you were getting tinkled on, or you felt like you were being power washed) and temperature (scalding hot, freezing cold, it's anyone's guess). The bed was comfy except for the flimsy pillows, and our room was kept very clean. The location is also amazing, we walked to nearly every major attraction in the first afternoon. I would have greatly enjoyed either a continental breakfast or breakfast room service option (room service in the evening was offered from the ajoining restaurant) as well as some gym amenities. All in all, decent stay.

review.title: Good downtown location.
review.reviewText:
This is an overall good hotel and would appeal to those with more refined and classic hotel tastes.  It has a theater in it and a high class restaurant next to it as well as being easy walking distance to a number of other different restaurants in the area to suite almost any pallet.

The staff was generally friendly and they have someone come in to play their grand piano a few nights a week which was a nice touch.
review.positiveRemarks: It had a classic 1920s hotel feel while being up to date at the same time. The beds were very comfortable and I generally slept well.
review.negativeRemarks: Improvements are limited by the location.
review.locationRemarks: There are tons of restaurants nearby and you are quick uber ride from Fisherman's Wharf and a number of other attractions and activities.

review.title: Sightseeing in SF
review.reviewText: Stayed one night, loved the location! Was able to catch the trolley just blocks away, beds were comfy, room was clean and staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to a lot of places
review.reviewText: We stayed two nights. All of the workers were great to us, the room was clean and comfy. We would get back to the hotel pretty late and there would always be a worker there to let us in with a smile on their face. Would of liked a little fridge or microwave because we had food delivered but other then that we were very satisfied. There are parking garages around and the hotel has vallet, we ended up using the hotel because every parking garage charged almost the same for overnight plus a lot easier through the hotel.

review.title: Quirky hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Kensington Park was close to Union Square, shopping, eating places, cable cars etc so a great location at a smaller price than some of the soulless chain hotels nearby. Our upgraded room on the 11th floor was very nice and the eclectic combination of hotel, theatre, bars and restaurant in the one building (sort of) made this a very interesting place to stay. The 20's/30's decor added to the overall interesting and comfortable feel of the hotel. Didn't have a lot to do with the staff as we were out most of the time but all interactions were friendly and professional. Would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable, clean, great decor, wifi always worked.
review.negativeRemarks: electrical power in the bathroom (lights, hairdryer) tended to fade to half occasionally
review.locationRemarks: shops, restaurants, cable cars to Fisherman's Wharf - all walkable from hotel

review.reviewText: It is old hotel, but look like authentic one. The stuff are kind.

review.title: Nice location, but rooms are small.
review.reviewText:
My husband is handicapped and we travel with a caregiver. No handicapped rooms are available for 3 people -  handicapped rooms only come with one king size bed. We were given a shower chair for my husband but he could not use it in the tub - no handrails in  the bathrooms - We had to give him a sponge bath in the middle of the bathroom. Room attendants graciously gave us enough towels to make this happen. Also door to room was very narrow - hard to get the wheelchair in and out.

Handrails were not available for any of the guests - we were at a family wedding and many relatives stayed at this hotel. Some were elderly and were concerned about the lack of safety rails in the bathrooms. 

Also, there is lack of communication among the hotel desk personnel especially between shifts. I gave the persons at the desk a hand written note indicating the time and day we would need a wheel accessible cab to get to the wedding rehearsal dinner. When it came to that date and time - no one from the hotel seemed to know about the request. I had to call for a cab myself and we were late for the dinner.
review.positiveRemarks: Coffee was available in the morning. Water and tea in the hotel lobby all day. Not far from small cafes and restaurants for meals.
review.negativeRemarks: More handicapped accessible facilities,
review.locationRemarks: Hop on Hop off bus stopped right across the street. Also public transportation just around the corner. Nice park nearby. Easy access to China town, et

review.title: Perfect.
review.reviewText: Perfect location.  Great staff.  And killer bed.  And it was quiet---highly unusual for a stay in SF.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, staff were courteous and helpful. Fantastic location. Tea,coffee and even sherry are free, but they charge for the bottles of water left in the room.....

review.title: Comfortable hotel in a central location
review.reviewText: Kensington Park is a comfortable, centrally located, hotel which offers all that you would need for your stay, close to shops, amenities and tourist destinations (we would definitely recommend the Ferry Building which is within walking distance!). Staff were friendly and our room was a good size. The decor is a bit tired and dated but this is something that we noticed for a lot of hotels in San Francisco. The plumbing is also rather noisy!
great price for the location, but would probably select a different hotel next time. sherry in the lobby every evening was a nice touch.

review.title: Nice hotel in good area.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, older building but well kept.  Great staff, very friendly and helpful.  Restaurants close and about 3 blocks from both Chinatown and Union Square.  expensive to park your car but there is valet parking.  If you are going to stay in town, this is a nice option.
review.negativeRemarks: Bar in the hotel would be good.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, Union square, shopping, restaurants

review.title: Royal suite
review.reviewText: Clean, Walking distant to union Square, ask for special rates and avoid room location facing the back area, it was noisy.

review.title: Hotel was aged.  Clean rooms though.
review.reviewText: Friendly staff.  Hotel is aged.  Great location.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Great location and quieter than most nearby hotels, being a half-block from Union Square (no street bands and few loud drunks) on an inbound one-way street. Close to cable cars, BART, and transit center. Attentive staff, clean, and well maintained. Oodles of shopping, dining, theater, and activities within a 3-block walk. We took BART from the airport to Powell Station, 3 blocks from the hotel. Used a City Pass for transport to every part of the city and never missed having a car. Very good experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Only complaint is that the room doors clang shut due to closers, so you'll hear every late reveler returning to their room.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square has everything. Restaurants from Burger King to Morton's and everything in between. Shopping galore. 20 mins. by cable car to the Wharf.

review.reviewText: It was great! Great staff! Clean room. Comfortable. Nice location. Super nice staff. Did I say that already?

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: From the Internet pics it kinda oversold the quality of the room and hotel. Needs updating and a workout room.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is very well located close to Powell street and Union Square. I would recomend the hotel for cleaninless only, otherways needs renovation asap. The sink in the bathroom is just above your knee level...very challenging to use.

review.title: Friendly, old world hotel with charm
review.reviewText:
The Kensington is an historic hotel situated close to Union Square.  With very friendly and knowledgeable staff, the room was comfortable and clean.  Everything was nearby including shopping and fine restaurants. 

In the afternoons, there was a piano player and tea or sherry for guests in the lobby.

The SF Playhouse is in the building with very good productions taking place nightly.

Part of the Personality Hotel Group, I would recommend this hotel for a lovely and relaxing experience.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the character of the hotel, the friendly staff, the excellent location.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel has most amenities.  It is not super modern and I liked it that way.  If the room is missing anything, even a fridge, they will get you one.
review.locationRemarks: Great, safe location near Union Square, Morton's, Farallon and shopping.  Cable car steps away.

review.title: THIS HOTEL IS THE WORST!
review.reviewText:
I arrived at 2 AM to check in and the staff refused to check me in. They would not even look at my confirmation or check the details of my booking. On Expedia, the confirmation said I could check in until 5 AM.

When I called the manager to discuss the situation and make things right, she was extremely rude and told me that none of this was her problem. I guess that the entire staff at this hotel is just rude and unprofessional. 

My advice: STAY AWAY!
review.negativeRemarks: THE STAFF
review.locationRemarks: EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS HOTEL IS TERRIBLE

review.title: Grace a terrible FO manager
review.reviewText: Grace the front office manager showed a rediculus behavior dealing with guests, using impolite words and non professional behavior.

review.title: Well located. Comfortable rooms.
review.reviewText:
Half a block from Union Square and the Cable Car, and only 5mins from the BART. We walked from the BART station (30mins from SFO) with our bags which saved plenty of money over a airport taxi/van. 

The rooms are well appointed, clean, and with space enough. We had a king bed which was very comfortable. Bathroom was also clean and well equipped.

No breakfast but plenty of near-by diners, cafes and restaurants.

All the staff were very friendly and helpful except the lady on check-in. She didn't even great us, simply said "Name" and then mumbled through the charges and various activities offered at the hotel. Not a great start.

Great hotel for the price, one of the best in my experience for this area.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Kensington Park is in the perfect location in downtown San Francisco. One block from the cable car line and shopping.

review.title: Location excelkent
review.reviewText:
Problem with hot water!!! Two mornings with none fir shower!  I was working and was frustrated!!  The second day was on day of departure and was leaving gut airport at 4am... Took a cold shower!!!

Spoke with manager.  Said she would send a voucher ... not yet received!

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: I paid what I considered an exorbidant price for a room at Kensington Park. I had upgraded from the Deluxe room to the next step up, for which I was to have received a view of either the skyline or Union Square, was to be located on the upper floors, room to be equipped with 2 phones. The only thing we got was the upper floor room. No view, 1 phone, icky tiled tub/shower, plastic furniture, damaged & water ringed wood furniture (what there was if it). I would not stay here again. Not a good value for the dollars I paid.

review.title: Excellent location near Union Square
review.reviewText: My husband and I spent a very enjoyable and comfortable stay here for four nights.  A very friendly and informative check in by Joshua.   We had room 34 on the seventh floor and we could just see the bay in the distance through the buildings. The hotel is just minutes from the historic cable car terminus and Powell Street BART.  The room and bathroom were very clean, lovely soft towels.  There was a coffee maker with a good supply of coffee. There is no air conditioning but there is a ceiling fan.  Every day between 16.00-18.00 complimentary tea and sherry is served in the foyer with a pianist playing at weekends.  Staff we encountered were all very courteous and friendly.  The Kensington Park is an older hotel with lots of character.  I would definately recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great hotel in SF
review.reviewText: The hotel is good value and is centrally located in terms of shopping and transport. It is convenient to also catch the cable car to Fishermans wharf. Also about 30 second walk to union square.

review.title: It was nice
review.reviewText: Everything was great.  We enjoyed our stay and had no issues.

review.title: Right off Union Square...
review.reviewText: Great location, historic hotel within walking distance to anything you need. Also is the location of the San Francisco playhouse...enjoyed the show "The Nether". Excellent !
review.positiveRemarks: The room was nicely appointet and updated. There was a trumpet player on the corner everynight that played beautiful music.
review.negativeRemarks: The paper products need to be upgraded to a higher quality. Very unhappy at the thinness and roughness.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is in walking distance, including the cable cars if you want to ride them. Shopping and restaurants for every taste.

review.reviewText: so comfortable, clean, good location, kind and friendly staff.

review.title: Kensington in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located which is a great convenience when staying in the city.  The room was average, but I found the room to be on the small side.  The bed and pillows were comfortable, there was a safe in the room but we didn't need to use it.  They do not have AC.  We went in February, so it wasn't a problem, but I found that to be strange.  Our window faced another building, so that was a bit disappointing.. no view of anything.  The coffee and tea in the morning were a nice touch.  The hotel staff was very helpful, we happen to leave the day of the Lunar New Year parade so the street was closed off, and we had to catch a taxi on the corner.  The girl at the front desk helped us with our luggage to the corner and got us a taxi.  We had an overall pleasant experience, and I would recommend the hotel, but would not stay again, I do prefer the area near Fisherman's Wharf..
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: There is a great deli downstairs to get breakfast early.

review.title: Great location in union square.
review.reviewText: Close to transit, restaurants, bars, shopping and entertainment. Easy to get around. Felt safe and found everyone we had contact with, being hotel staff, retail and or street people, friendly. We love San Fransisco! We will be back.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice location. Clean room. Valet parking is expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: The location of this hotel is very good, it closes to everything.

review.title: Easy access to all touristic spots in SF
review.reviewText:
I stayed at Kensington Park Hotel for 4 days and I really enjoyed my stay. Even if I heard lots of news about downtown area and people had told me downtown SF is not safe, I can honestly say, I absolutely felt safe in this area. Kensignton hotel is located in a very safe area right across the union square, there are tons of shopping centers, restaurants, cafe, etc around then hotel. This is very walkable city and if you used to walk alot, you can simply walk to every where. However, there is a grand public transportation.
Personally I enjoyed walking in SF. From my hotel I walked to the City hall, Farmers market, convention center, public library and it was all less than 15 minute walk for me as I walk fast.
I also walked to Ferry building and financial district which was about 30 minuted walk. I also walked to China Town, Nob hill, and many other areas. 
5 minute walk from hotel, you will reach to the Cable Car station which gives you ride to Fisherman Wharf. With 1 Bus you can go to Pier 39 as well as Alcatraz Landing. In order to go to the airport, it only takes you 7 minute walk to get to the BART metro station and you don't even need a cab to go to the airport. 
The hotel itself was perfect for me. My room was on 9th floor, I had a nice view, very comfortable king bed, clean and quiet room. Every morning from 7am to 10 am they served complimentary tea & coffee on the 9th and 11th floor. Then between 4pm to 6pm they served complementary tea and sherry in the lobby. So dur
Great staff, good location. Bathrooms could be updated but others than that, a great stay!

managementResponses.response: Thank you for staying at Kensington Park Hotel. We are pleased to hear you had a great time. We hope to welcome you back again in the near future.

review.title: Close to union square
review.reviewText: The hotel is dated but has personality . Staff was very nice and helpful. We had a great time.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for sharing your feedback. We hope to see you again during your future visits to San Francisco.

review.title: Union Square
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel convenient to the Moscone Center and Union Square. The staff was very helpful and friendly.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for sharing your positive experience. We are glad Robert steered you in the right direction, he is quite a guy! We hope to see you again the near future.

review.reviewText: The concierge, Robert, is a gem.  He knows the town and the good restaurants.  He directed us to some good places we had not known before.
review.negativeRemarks: It's an old hotel with old furnishings and paint

managementResponses.response: Thank for choosing Kensington Park Hotel. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and all the surrounding restaurants and amenities. We hope to see you again during your future visits to San Francisco.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Just a short walk to Union Square and a hop onto the cable cars to the wharf. The San Francisco Playhouse is within the hotel and was able to take in a great show (Stage Kiss) while there. The hotel is also directly connected to the Farallon Restaurant with great seafood and a door down is Morton's Steakhouse. A block away is a popular gastro pub (Hogwash).  All in all a newly renovated hotel with unusual amenities (the citrus water, sherry, and hot tea was a nice touch).

managementResponses.response: Thank you for sharing your feedback. We appreciate your comments and are pleased to hear you enjoyed our location. We hope you will consider staying with us again in the future.

review.title: this is and old and small hotel with a big price
review.reviewText: The ahotel is in a nice location and the staff is friendly, however the rest of the xperience is not worth the price
review.negativeRemarks: This facility needs major upgrades to everything
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, great location

managementResponses.response: Thank you for staying with us at Kensington Park Hotel. We are very happy to hear that you had a great experience and enjoyed your stay. We hope to see you again during your future visits to San Francisco.

review.title: Convenient and good location
review.reviewText: Good location for shopping and trams. Within walking distance to Chinatown and shops

managementResponses.response: Thank you for sharing your experience. It is important for us to know where we can improve and hope you will consider staying with us again in the future.

review.title: Lots of Potential
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location, just off Union Square, within walking distance to shopping, Chinatown, and even Pier 39 if you are up for a hike. As the other reviews stated, the beds are very comfortable and the linens terrific; very nice to come back to after a long afternoon, as was the pianist in the lobby who played beautifully.  We were able to check in early, which was very accommodating.  On the downside, the movies on demand was out of service during our stay and the desk told me that the techs were out for Christmas.  One of the two elevators was out of order, as well.  The renovations in the bathroom were sloppy. The walls are paper thin and we woke up to our neighbor blowing his nose, burping and announcing "rise and shine" to his companion.  So these things were disappointing.  We really wanted to love this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is terrific and the rooms are very comfortable, super clean, and housekeeping was quiet and not intrusive. The staff was very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The facility needs to be in better working condition.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square and everything that goes along with it.  The St. Francis is right around the corner, and shopping abounds.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: The hotel was great and I would definitely stay here again.  Rooms were a good size for SF.  Everything was clean and hotel staff was great.  Older hotel but well kept.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was perfect.  Hotel staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel. Great location.
review.reviewText: Very clean. Great location. Nice staff. The beds were a little uncomfortable.

review.title: As comfortable as your favorite pair of slippers.
review.reviewText:
Built in 1925 and it shows; elegant lobby details, appropriate furnishings.
Central to City center and public transport hubs.
Friendly and helpful staff.

It was nice, the only downside is the doors close very fast and loudly! You can hear everyone's door close, there was one night where the room next door kept making a lot of noise and slamming doors. We did have to call through to concierge at 2am in the morning, once we did that the room next door kept it down

review.title: Good hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel - full of character and excellent situation - close to the main shopping district and the cable car - would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel.  horrible service.
review.reviewText: I should've known I was in for a problem when the maintenance man pulled my luggage from the car and the concierge was my bell boy.  Extremely under staffed.  They charged me over double on my debit card and when I asked them about it, they told me they couldn't help me because they no one knew how this could possibly happen.  Luckily, my bank was able to get involved and get things started.  Once I put this in place, all the manager needed to do was send a fax that I was told would be sent in 20 minutes.  4 hours later, my bank called and informed me that they hadn't received the fax.  At this point, I'm at a very nice restaurant having my birthday dinner.  I called the hotel and the manager had left for the day and the person at the front desk told me she was left to send the fax but didn't know how to work the fax machine.  Needless to say, I was pretty upset. After some back and forth, she finally admitted that she didn't have the correct fax number and told me she couldn't help me and then asked me if there was anything else she could do for me.  When I laughed at this, she told me she had a customer and hung up.  I did get the correct fax number from my bank, called her back and she suddenly knew how to use the fax machine.  Unpleasant dinner, poor customer service from the hotel staff.  The best part of this story is that not one person from the hotel apologized to me, but they had no problem taking my money.  too bad because the hotel has potential.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located

review.title: First trip to San Francisco - we will be back !!
review.reviewText: We came to the city having only ever visited New York previously - much prefer San Francisco - more laid back and so easy to get around. The hotel is very well placed to explore the whole city as it is pretty central. The welcome was warm as was the weather which was a pleasant surprise as it is November - beautiful sunny days but chilly evenings. So much to see and do. Another heart has been left there !!

review.title: Don't stay here
review.reviewText:
This is a very old hotel, and in my opinion, it was overpriced even for downtown San Francisco.
The biggest issue was:  No hot water in the morning to shower.
Enough said.
When I asked at the front desk if any discount or credit would be forthcoming given no hot water, the gentleman said he would "have to ask my manager" which is less than optimal customer service.

I was not too thrilled about the facilitiy. There was no Gym or breafast facilty onsite. The hotel front was undergoing construction which I get but there was water everywhere. It was difficult to hail a cab and a couple of times when we called Uber they would not let them wait for even a little bit.

review.title: Very convenient location!
review.reviewText: My friend and I went to San Francisco for a 4-day visit and found this hotel to be very conveniently located near Union Square and other amenities -- near the main cable car stops and the buses.   We found the room to be very comfortable and pleasant, no real complaints at all.  Friendly staff too.  We enjoyed the tea, sherry and water on offer to guests every afternoon although we were not always around to take advantage of it.

review.title: The hotel is in need of an upgrade!
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located next to Union Square which makes it an ideal location. The check in process was great with the Guest Agent being very courteous and efficient. The room was clean and comfortable but could definitely use an update. The biggest issue we had was with the washroom. We stayed in room 45 and the shower head was so congested with calcium deposits that the water coming out was virtually non existent. When you try to adjust the head, it either came out in a fine mist barely or a straight downpour which was not enough to stand under to get cleaned up. Also, when someone close by turned on their water, the temperature in ours varied greatly. The vanity is this room as well is unusually low as well which made it seem strange. Our friends stayed in another room and did not have any of these experiences so we'll just chalk this one up to poor maintenance of this room.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location. Central to all the action of Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: Maintenance of the rooms.

review.title: Rude staff ruined trip
review.reviewText: the lazy, rude staff ruined an otherwise enjoyable trip. the doorman John stood and watched as I struggled to get my luggage and couldn't even to open the door.

review.reviewText: I have stayed in several hotels near Union Square over the years. I chose this hotel because the location is convenient and it looked clean. Upon arrival, the condition of the hotel was not what I saw in their pics, it was run down and shabby. It was disappointing to learn 1) there is no gym and 2) no room service. You can order from Morton's next door after 4pm but nothing before. What hotel doesn't have room service, especially in a city like San Francisco?!?
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were great and accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the hotel, add a gym and room service.

review.title: Frequent Visitor
review.reviewText: This is may second stay at the Kensington and the customer service has greatly improved over the years.  I normally stay at the Parc 55 Hotel with it's great location, but by far I prefer the Kensington Park.  Wonderful old world charm and the room was wonderful, even though the bathroom was incredibly small (for one person it was perfect).  The Kensington Park is steps to the corner of Powell and Post (across the street from Union Square) and a Cable Car stop.  Three blocks from the closes Walgreens.  My room faced the back of the hotel and it was very quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: Cozy and charming feel to the room.
review.negativeRemarks: It would have been great if the hotel room had a refrigerator.  Also, the rooms have old doors which you need to pull hard to close which make noise.
review.locationRemarks: Cable Car Stop at the corner, Walgreens three blocks down, DSW at the corner, two coffee shops next door abd Morton's Steak House next door.

We found the afternoon staff to be friendly, knowledgable and helpful, with great recommendations for food and directions. The rooms are small, but adequate, we did not feel crammed in, even with our luggage, and 2 bikes. Parking is not on the hotel property so we had to keep pour bikes with us in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: location, clean comfy room, David, our concierge was great.

review.reviewText:

Half a block from union square and all the action, stores and restaurants. Can't beat the price. Only down fault no a/c but it does have a cealing fan so you'll survive.

review.title: Elks Lodge
review.reviewText:
Stayed here because of the Elks Lodge.  The room was tiny and hot.  The bed was comfortable.  The noise level was unacceptable.  The only way to cool the room down was to open the window, but it would only open 2 inches.  One could hear everything on the floor and the doors slam shut on their own.  The valet service was unacceptable.  Average wait time was 40 minutes.  When I asked for the Elks discount, I was told I could only get that by calling the hotel manager to book my reservation.  Even though when you visit the website to get the number, the only number you get directs you to their primary number in India.
    All night long we had to listen to the SF Metro Fire EMTs boop their siren.  The sink counter in the bathroom was so small we had to use the toilet to set things on.
review.positiveRemarks: Only the bed, staff, and location.
review.negativeRemarks: see above

review.reviewText: I was looking for a boutique style, smaller hotel for our trip to San Francisco and came across the personality hotels.  The Kensington was great.  We appreciated the smaller, intimate atmosphere.  Excellent customer service.  Friendly staff.  Clean rooms.  I will book another personality hotel for our next trip to SF.

review.title: Location is excellent.
review.reviewText:
It has been a long day for myself and my wife, upon arrival at the hotel and once we got into the room immediately retired. About half an hour later a knocked at the door saying if we wanted to change the beddings (which I originally requested No Feather Pillows/No Down Comforters) made that request during my reservation online. Anyways I turned down the summoned as we were already in bed sleeping. 10 mins later another knocked saying if we wanted the bedding change, I said again not anymore. I thought that was it, but the following morning before 9 a.m. another knocked at the door asking if we he can come in for maintenance check, I declined as we were checking out anyways.
Annoyed by the incident.
review.positiveRemarks: Front Desk people very pleasant and courteous!
review.negativeRemarks: Verify first if guest/occupant had check in before knocking 3xs and attempted to enter the room.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent Location!

review.title: O.K. hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Hot room with no A/C. Valet is shared with other hotels I think. Takes 45 min. to get car. They say 15 to 20 min. but not at all correct.

review.title: Elegant old small hotel
review.reviewText: Very comfortable.  Staff terrific.  Like stepping back in time.  Walking distance to all tourist spots and good restaurants.  Would book again.
review.negativeRemarks: Frig in room
review.locationRemarks: Famous restaurants. Union square.  Walking distance to fisherman's wharf.  Elegant shopping if you want designer stuff.

review.title: Nice location. Close to trolley.
review.reviewText: Had a great 3 day mini vacation. Enjoyed the location.
It was great! Loved the room and experience at Kensington hotel!
Good location, but extra cost for car parking and no breakfast.

review.title: Great location, near Union Square!
review.reviewText: I enjoyed staying at the Kensington Park because the staff was great and the location was awesome. It is just a block away from Union Square.
Comfortable rooms, great location. Loved the freebies (wifi, sherry, coffee, toiletries). Sometimes the channels on the television would not show up, but other than that, it was great!

review.title: Great location in the heart of downtown
review.reviewText: A fun little hotel with a personality. Rooms were a little dark but clean. My friends and I didn't really stay inside too much to know the amenities, but there was a theatre in the building and it could be great if you enjoy theatre. The staff was very polite and courteous. Sheets and towels were clean, hairdryer and tv worked fine. The bed was a little too soft for me peraonally but I slept fine. The main reason I picked this was its proximity to transportation, cafes and food. Overall a great value for the deal I got through expedia.

review.reviewText: Great access to union square and public transportation.  David, the concierge, was great.  Every food/restaurant recommendation of his was spot on and delicious. review.reviewText: Needs updating.  Brass fittings on shower/bath were tarnished and didn't cover tile hole.  Window did not open correctly.  Tv reception poor.  Bed was comfortable.  Staff was good.

review.title: Beautiful, historic hotel best deal around
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful though they are undergoing construction. When you arrive, you take a step back in time to a more ornate dat. My room was very quiet and had an ok view. The bed linens and other expected amenities were superb.  We are not greeted by the valet nor the staff with much urgency, but the front desk people were nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The historic comfort of the boutique hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Better signage, friendly valet, easier places to unload.
review.locationRemarks: The location is safe and near lots of shopping. We were able to walk to most of the attractions very quickly.

review.reviewText: Great location. Close to everything. Hotel room kind like old weird design .

review.title: Ideal location
review.reviewText:
Had a great 4 day stay. Quiet room, very comfy bed, terrific shower with lots of hot water (at all times of day), & a view window that opened for fresh air. Easy walking distance to Cable Car, F Trolly line, & Powell Bart station making all of SF easily accessible. 
The AI Weiwei installation was an huge added bonus to the Alcatraz visit.

review.title: Not worth the $$
review.reviewText: We booked this room for two nights, wanting something in central San Francisco. On Expedia it was advertised at $170 night total. The booking process took it to $200/night. Then parking was $45/night - taking the room to over $250/night after taxes. We were told there was breakfast - it was coffee. The room was very small. I'd recommend a Motor Inn downtown (there was many) over this overpriced hotel.

The hotel is very old, but clean. It is not a posh hotel. The room was refurbished and remodeled inside, which was a nice surprise. The bed was very comfortable. Only half a block away from Union Square and very convenient.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel close to Union Square. The bed is pretty comfortable.

review.title: Christmas shopping getaway
review.reviewText: We thought this place was perfect for us.  The room was nice and very reasonably priced, especially for it's great location.  We wouldn't hesitate to come back again.
Great location close to cable car line and union square   Staff very helpful and friendly

review.title: Comfortable and reasonably priced
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an older building that got its last update quite a while ago but has been very well maintained.  Appropriately priced, comfortable bed, up high enough to be quiet.

We celebrated our 50th wedding anniversary in San Francisco and we were delighted in our choice of a hotel.  The staff is friendly and so helpful and being located close to Union Square is a real plus.

review.title: Great Location close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Very impressed with this quaint historic Elks Lodge hotel!  Although the Elks lodge is completely separate from the hotel now, there is great history in this building and you can feel it.  We had a wonderful stay there.
review.locationRemarks: Sears Fine Dining around the corner on Powell was our "go to" restaurant because of the the delicious food, great service and festive ambiance!

review.title: Perfect location.
review.reviewText: There was a lot going on in San Francisco while we were there...demonstrations, Santa com and shoppers.  We were in the middle of it and it didn't hinder our fun.  Great staff, comfortable room.  We've stayed there 8 years and loved it.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of a thing
review.locationRemarks: Shop, people watch, right by cable car, walking distance to many good restaurants.  Walking distance to China Town.

review.reviewText:
Booked this on Expedia, so mostly went on the price and pretty pictures on their
website.
Loved the location of this Hotel, however was disappointed in
the amenities or lack thereof.  The staff at reception were great.  
We experienced the worst storm since the 50"s while at this Hotel, so when
the lights went out and the water didn't run, we walked down 10 or 12 flights of
stairs to the lobby, mostly in the dark since the emergency lights didn't go
on every floor.  Thank goodness we had a very tiny flashlight.  
Would have thought management would have checked on guests to see that we
were ok!  Quite an adventure.  
I would recommend this Hotel mostly for its location.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to shopping and restaurants in downtown.
review.negativeRemarks: Amenities need improving
review.locationRemarks:
Again, this Hotel is in the perfect location to Union Square, 
theater and dining.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Great hotel for the price being near union square . The location ,room size and super comfortable bed ,the reception area when u first enter does not look that great but the rooms make up for it .I would stay there again ...
review.negativeRemarks: The recepition area needs updating

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: The Kensington Park Hotel is perfectly located 1/2 block off of Union Square. The hotel staff is excellent. The hotel is older and has many charming characteristics. Our room faced Nob Hill and was very quiet. Would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: More soap in room. One small piece is not enough for shower and basin.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and many restaurants very, very close.

review.title: awesome stay
review.reviewText: great location, friendly staff, free sherry! really enjoyed the atmosphere, and the older building was modernized to just the right extent for us.

review.title: Good hotel for a good price
review.reviewText: Great location. Good deal. Small rooms but huge bathrooms. Wish we had a mini fridge. Cool view from 6th floor.

review.title: Nice hotel right in the action.
review.reviewText: Great location in the heart of San francisco. Room was clean hotel staff friendly and helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel busy street
review.reviewText: The hotel was being refurbished. The parking conditions are horrible.  They offered valet but it costs almost $45.00 per day.  The valet attendant was very nice and helpful.  Room was nice and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking conditions. Also serve a few pastries with coffee.

review.title: Located right by Union Square
review.reviewText: Whenever in San Francisco, always stay at Kensington for the location, price and great customer service.
review.negativeRemarks: The drape is in dire need of cleaning. We noticed when closing the window that it is quite soiled.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, shopping, shopping!! Easy access to desired points of interest and transportation.

review.reviewText: Loved the hotel, great location. Staff was really friendly and we had an incredible view!

review.title: Great location. Very clean.
review.reviewText: Staff was courteous and attentive. Very clean. Great location. Will stay here again.

review.title: Great location to union square and restaurants!
review.reviewText: Good experience.. Second stay in hotel. Situation occurred with night reception, but problem solved efficiently with Manager... Great hotel staff, very helpful and friendly! Beds are so comfortable!

review.title: Great Hotel in Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: The concierge was very friendly, the desk was professional, the room was conveniently located (10th floor) between the free coffee (9th and 11th floors). The elevator even has a couch for tired walkers. The lobby reminded us of early 20th century but was clean fresh and interesting to look at. Cable cars on the corner took us to Fisherman's Wharf, the BART is only 4 blocks away. Nice convenient restaurants all around. Lots of shopping all around. Best of all we were there when the Giants won the World Series and got to see all the fans go crazy in the sports bar and then the streets. We were there for our daughter's wedding at the courthouse at the same time the city had their parade for the Giants right outside on Haloween. So thank you San Francisco and Kensington Park Hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: The downtown location was great. The cable cars and the BART were so convenient. The beds were very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: A free continental breakfast next to the coffee would have been great!
review.locationRemarks: See our experience above

review.title: Enjoyed my stay
review.reviewText: Very clean and comfortable room. It's a bit small, but it has all you need and the bed is incredibly comfortable. It's in a great location and even though it does not have air conditioning it was very cool.

review.title: San Francisco Visit
review.reviewText: I loved the location.  I had rented 2 rooms and one room was ready and the other room was read at al 4 pm.  You could here everything in your neighbors room and I could hear the elevator all night long including the bell dinging every time it stopped on our floor.  I would probably not stay here again unless they have some quiet rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were very comfortable and so were the pillows.
review.negativeRemarks: The room should have been ready by 3 at the latest.  We had a play to go to and it put us a little panic to be on time.
review.locationRemarks: I loved the location and my favorite restaurant called the Farallon is joining the hotel.  That was ideal.

review.title: The Kensington Park Hotel - It's got personality!
review.reviewText: I stayed here overnight for business.   It's a classy classic boutique hotel. Good value.  I had a top floor view of the skyline.  Bed was comfy, cozy and posh!  Hotel staff was very polite and welcoming.
review.negativeRemarks: One little drawback is that the bathrooms could be updated.
review.locationRemarks: Hey, it's near Union Square! You can shop or catch a short cab ride to the opera!

review.title: Nice find, close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Older hotel with lots of character.  Well maintained with helpful staff.  It is just half a block from the cable cars and Union Square.  No air conditioning but not a problem since the windows open and there is a ceiling fan.  Will be back to stay here again for sure.

review.title: Nice find, close to Union Square.

review.title: Magnificent

review.negativeRemarks: nothing; okay, maybe some Danish offerings with coffee in the morning : -)

review.title: OVERALL WONDERFUL
review.reviewText:
WAS EXPECTING SOMETHING PERHAPS A BIT MORE UPSCALE FOR THE PRICE, BUT AFTER ALL, IT WAS 1/2 BLOCK OFF UNION SQUARE. BEDS WERE VERY COMFORTABLE WITH AN ABUNDANCE OF PILLOWS (TWO CHOICES - BOTH DOWN & FIBREFILLED). THE ROOM WAS VERY CLEAN AND NICELY APPOINTED, AND THE HOTEL STAFF COULD NOT POSSIBLY HAVE BEEN NICER OR MORE HELPFUL. 
WOULD DEFINITELY BOOK THIS HOTEL AGAIN!
review.positiveRemarks: PRETTY MUCH EVERYTHING. AS I SAID, THE HOTEL STAFF WERE WONDERFUL AND OVERALL, OUR STAY THERE WAS PERFECT.
review.negativeRemarks: THIS IS AN OLDER HOTEL, AND THE HALLS HAVE NOT BEEN "UPDATED", BUT THE ROOMS THEMSELVES WERE VERY NICE.
review.locationRemarks: RIGHT OFF UNION SQUARE - THE PERFECT LOCATION FOR SHOPPING, DINING, AND BEING IN THE CENTER OF THE CITY.

review.title: One Night at the Kensington
review.reviewText:
The location is excellent and parking is convenient.  Afternoon sherry and tea is a lovely touch and the small lobby is elegant.  The room, however, was a disappointment.  The only window looked directly into the windows of a racket club.
The 3 of us, (Grandmother, daughter, and 14 year old boy) were crammed as if sardines.  I recommend this hotel for singles or couples only
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and the staff was friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Expedia booking leaves a lot to be desired.  It is far too general.  I would not have booked this hotel room for 3 people!
review.locationRemarks: The location is excellent. Everything is within walking distance/

review.title: Good one night.
review.reviewText:
Always wanted to stay at this hotel.  Lived in San Francisco and had friends stay here.  Worked next door at Farallon and have gone to plays upstairs.  Loved that I could finally stay there.  The property is very unique and perfect for our visit.
Joshua at the front desk was great when we checked in and the doorman was very helpful as well.  The room was very clean and quiet.
As it is a charming older property expect to have few outlets for plugging in your phones etc.  Expect a tiny bathroom but everything worked for the most part.
Would definitely consider staying there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve coffee/tea service.  Very easy in a food city like SF.
review.locationRemarks: Trolley is a block away.  Union Square.  Easy access to everything the city has to offer.

review.title: Conveniently located
review.reviewText: I wanted a hotel near Union Square. This hotel is within walking distance to the cable cars, bus lines, and shopping center. I enjoyed the historic archetecture. If your are looking for a small hotel with historical charm, this is it.

review.title: Lovely boutique hotel at Union Square
review.reviewText: Loved the location- close to Union Square and Cable cars.  I was attending a conference at Moscone Centre which was a short walk away.  All the shopping and restaurants you want in easy walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing missing was bath robes!! oh and a newspaper

And the location makes it easy to get to wherever you want to go in San Francisco :)

review.title: Great hotel, fabulous price, and perfect location
review.reviewText: We stayed on the 9th floor during a heat wave. The only street noise we heard from the open window was the trumpet playing from Union Square. It was a great stay. The staff was courteous and always willing to help. The theater is on the second floor. A piano is on the bottom floor with sherry and tea served daily at 4-6 pm. The location was also great!

review.title: Great location, room was a little "tired"
review.reviewText: I've happily stayed at the Kensington Park Hotel 3 times before.  However, this time I must have drawn their worst room (#10).  The carpet was buckled and badly in need of stretching; the glass bathroom shelf is installed at an angle so everything rolls off, rendering it unusable; the top drawer of the dresser was not usable because it falls out - just to name a few things.  Should have tried to change room, but husband was immovable.  Not the hotel's fault but, like in Manhattan, there is a lot of noise outside day and night, so next time try to get a higher floor to abate the noise.
review.positiveRemarks: Entire front desk staff is always so helpful. I witnessed very sympathetic response to guest with some unidentified misfortune. Awesome housekeepers.
review.negativeRemarks: A little maintenance would improve Room #10 and any room in similar conditino.
review.locationRemarks: Disney Museum (4 miles) is fantastic.  Sodini's Restaurant in North Beach-even better than Soto Mare! Moustafa @ Saks is #1 in men's fragrances.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your feedback. I am sorry to hear that your stay at Kensington Park Hotel was not as enjoyable as you may have expected. Please note that all rooms are equipped with ceiling fans. We do not have fitness facilities on the premises, however all guests are welcome to use the fitness center at our sister property hotel Diva, located just a block away from Kensington Park Hotel. In regards to the room service, we do offer room service after 4:30PM trough Morton’s Steakhouse.

Please accept my deepest apology for the inconvenience. I hope that you will give the Kensington Park Hotel another chance in future.

Sincerely,

Dimitar Stanev
Hotel Manger

review.title: Beware climate control
review.reviewText: Expedia claims climate control but no a/c and very old and tiny rooms. Also no fitness facilities and no room service. Won't go back.

review.title: Close to shops and restaurants.
review.reviewText: Great stay. Quite hotel with great views of the city. Late, noon, check out allows an easy morning and a nice brunch nearby before leaving the hotel. Smaller room size not for spending very long time there. But one would be out enjoy the city, shops and restaurants anyway.

review.title: Very Charming
review.reviewText: Quaint hotel right around the corner from Union Square.  The lobby was done up in 1800s style decor and was absolutely enchanting, and between 4 and 6 pm they serve complimentary tea and sherry.  The rooms were a bit more modern, though they did have a couple of pieces of antique furniture.  The beds were comfy, the staff was friendly, and the hotel is pet friendly, even going so far as to have a welcoming bowl of water and bucket of treats for canine guests.  No AC, but it wasn't that hot during our stay and the ceiling fan was good enough for me.  The hotel was also close to a bus stop as well as a cable car stop.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the way it was decorated.  Almost made me feel like I was visiting it in its heyday.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing that could have made it better would be if they offered/included breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Right around the corner from Union Square, very close to a bus stop, and lots of nearby shopping.  Chinatown is about a 10 minute walk.

managementResponses.response:
Hi Bill,

Thank you for staying with us at Kensington Park Hotel. We are very happy to hear that enjoyed your second stay with us and saw our true personality! We hope to see you again soon.

Warm Regards
Megan Brandt
Guest Relations

review.title: Full of personality
review.reviewText:
Second visit and we will be back.
The hotel has lots of history and quirkiness that handsomely distinguishes it from modern robotic hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: Redo carpets
review.locationRemarks: Excellent central location. Jazz in union square was good and chinatown is a great conduit to fisherman's wharf!

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Great Hotel at a Great Location
review.reviewText: This is a really cool hotel with great staff n great location. Union Square is right there. We loved the look n feel of the rooms. Highly recommended!

managementResponses.response:
Hi Nan,

Thanks for choosing Kensington Park Hotel during your visit to San Francisco. So happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and that the staff helped ease your travels. We hope you'll think of us again on your next visit.

Warm Regards,
Megan Brandt
Guest Relations

review.title: Great Location & nice hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was very good. Knowledgeable. They made it easy to be a single traveler. Helpful in every way. Only downside - elevator a little slow.
review.negativeRemarks: Old building - I don't think you can do much about the elevator.
review.locationRemarks: About 1 block off of Union Square - 2 doors up from Morton's Steak House. Nice little restaurant 1 door up. Walking distance to just about everything

review.title: Quite Hotel, Great Location!
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, the staff were friendly and accommodating and the location was perfect. Very close to shopping, great restaurants and of course the cable car lines.
review.negativeRemarks: Continental breakfast with the complimentary coffee would be a nice touch…fresh fruit/muffins/yogurt.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping, close to Union Square and quick/easy transportaion to the Pier.

managementResponses.response:
Hi Justin,

Thank you for choosing to stay with us. We are glad that you had a good stay, but wish that we could have meet your expectations all along the way. Parking prices in down town San Francisco can seem pretty expensive, and almost all of the hotel in the area have a parking fee. We hope we will have the pleasure to have you back.

Kind Regards,
Megan Brandt
Guest Relations

review.title: Great location next to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Hotel was easy to find. Extremely hard to get parking in front of hotel and they advise you to double park and wait for valet to come out. Parking lots in the area charge $30 overnight and here they charge $40 or in my case $45 for a truck to valet it(found a dent & paint chip after picking it up on last day). And they advise you it Staff was very helpful and friendly. Hotel has a classic charm and full of history. They have a computer available for use in lobby and free WiFi. We got a room with 2 double beds. Beds were extremely small for my family and no pull-out couch bed. Room was small with a table, dresser, and chair. Bathroom was nice with gold plated handles. Overall very clean and not bad for a hotel in a great location.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was perfect for all of our outings including: union square, trolly's, chinatown, and close to Fisherman's Warf.
review.negativeRemarks: Only disappointment was with parking. It was hard to just park to check-in, very expensive, took 20-45 minutes for them to get car.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Union Square, trolly's, and Chinatown. Short drive to Fishermans Warf and Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Nice downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Very good location, nice staff, clean rooms, good bed, good bathroom, no complaints.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel about 20 yrs. ago and will continue to stay here as often as I visit SF. The hotel is close to really good restaurants and Union Square. The staff is very accommodating. The hotel is very quiet, no garbage trucks waking you up at 5 a.m. The room was very clean and plenty of linens. There is no air conditioning, but you do not need it.
review.positiveRemarks: The closeness to Union Square and restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: A charming thing about this hotel was they had coffee, tea, muffins, scones and jams in an armoire on your floor waiting for you in the morning.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, always entertainment there. Good restaurants close by and plenty of shopping.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel is located at the great location, two blocks to Union Square. Staff are very accommodating and helpful. The room is a little small and unfortunately, when we were at San Francisco a few days ago, it was very warm. Mid-80's. The hotel does not have air conditioning, so it is a little warm. My daughter in her mid 20s is very impressed with the structure of the hotel

managementResponses.response:
Dear Craig,

Thank you for taking time to write about your recent stay at Kensington Park. We are very pleased to hear it was an enjoyable stay and that the location allowed you to easily explore San Francisco. We are also glad to staff took great care of you. We hope to see you again during future visits!
Best,
Dimitar Stanev, Hotel Manager

review.title: Excellent location near Union Square
review.reviewText: Entire staff very helpful and friendly. Good advice for what to see and do and good directions and arrangements. Note: they will arrange a car to take you to the airport if you need it, $50.00 plus tip. It's a big clean SUV. This place is right next to Union Square and near all the major shopping and resturants and transportation, the cable cars are half a block away. We did not have a car and didn't need one, the city is easy to navigate.Hotel is very comfortable and clean, nice cozy lobby. Don't be put off by the no A/C in the rooms, you don't need it. It was in the high 80's when we were there and it was very comfortable. Great stay, we'd go back.
review.negativeRemarks: In our room (#31) a little more space next to the toilet would have been nice!!
review.locationRemarks: Great location---------everything is nearby, you could spend a week & not do it all

managementResponses.response:
Dear Ann,

Thanks for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience at Kensington Park Hotel! We are glad to hear it was a return visit and that you enjoyed your stay with us once again. We hope to see you again during future visits to San Francisco!
Best,
Dimitar Stanev, Hotel Manager

review.title: Excellent second stay at Kensington Park
review.reviewText: The staff was very accommodating and held our luggage for us before we checked in & after check out so we could explore the city even more. Stayed for 3 nights in a comfortable & clean deluxe king. There was a huge closet. The bathroom was small but clean. The room was fairly quiet considering it is in downtown SF. This was my 2nd stay here and I'd come back again. I love staying in places with character and not at a generic brand. The Victorian decor is beautiful-- I loved the ceiling in the lobby. You won't find that at the Marriott! The location is fantastic-- just a block to shopping, restaurants, cable car and other public transportation. We walked almost everywhere.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is fantastic. Room is comfortable. Staff is accommodating and knowledgeable about their fair city.
review.negativeRemarks: A bathroom in the lobby would be nice. The one on the 2nd floor isn't always open.
review.locationRemarks: You can walk everywhere. The hotel is near shopping in Union Square, restaurants, Chinatown and North Beach are short walks away.

managementResponses.response:

Warm Regards
Dimitar Stanev, Hotel Manager

review.title: Nice hotel very close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Lobby is a bit dated but rooms are lovely --- updated furnishings, very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby a bit dated
review.locationRemarks: Right off Union Square --- great shopping, restaurants and theater

review.title: hotel review
review.reviewText: Pleasant older hotel. Very good value when booked through expedia but added one day and had to pay much much more. Although there may have been a season break this left an unpleasant memory. The front desk staff could not help to recognize our loyalty. Bad marketing.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms need some work.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: From the moment we walked into this beautiful place we were taken care of. The room was beautiful, the staff helpful, and perfectly located. The beds are a dream.

managementResponses.response:

Dimitar Stanev, Hotel Manager

review.title: Lovely hotel excellent location had a fantastic ti
review.reviewText: Hotel was in an excellent location for seeing all the sights walking distance to pier 39 and the north beach Chinatown any many more. Alcatraz is well worth a visit and the sightseeing hop on and off buses very enjoyable plus we were blessed with lovely sunshine which made it all the more enjoyable.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was lovely very friendly staff Bob the head porter was very friendly and helpful. The room was a good size
review.negativeRemarks: Toilets downstairs in the lobby would be nice. Apart from that everything was great
review.locationRemarks: The location was excellent waking distance to most of the attractions, plenty of diners restaurants and bars. Shops and shopping mall just blocks away

review.title: Kensington Park Hotel - A Little Disappointing!
review.reviewText: An alright hotel in an excellent location but I would not stay here again. It has a nice feel but could do with a good paint and updating.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel has a good location.
review.negativeRemarks: The internal decoration of the hotel is dated and needs to be updated. The rooms are generally comfortable but it just looks tired!

review.title: BEAUTIFUL BOUTIQUE place to stay in San Fran
review.reviewText: Ambience! Old world charm. The accompanying restaurant (Farallon) is absolutely wonderful
review.positiveRemarks: Ambience! Old world charm. The accompanying restaurant (Farallon) is absolutely wonderful
review.locationRemarks: Brilliant location right near Union Square

review.title: Fabulous hotel very close to Union Square
review.reviewText: A small, beautifully renovated hotel oozing old world charm. The rooms are not huge, but the bed has to be the best bed I've ever slept in in my life...you simply sink into it. Staff is wonderful, complimentary coffee and tea in the morning, Sherry & tea in the late afternoon. Would recommend this hotel to anyone I know except those who require a massive bedroom and a shower that fits an entire basketball team. Next time in San Francisco, we will positively stay here from now on. Loved it.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants very close by, including Scala, Forno, Kuleto's, Burger Bar, cable cars, Sur La Table, Crate & Barrel & Macy's
