review.title: Horrible!
review.reviewText: Unfriendly staff, small room, booked on expedia so they assumed we were poor based upon their reaction, smelly room w/no ac!!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Historic hotel in a great location. Rooms are small but it was very clean and the bed was comfortable.

review.title: Vintage hotel perfect for enjoying San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great location to get anywhere we wanted to go, The staff was delightful. The hotel was old, yet updated. We enjoyed the morning coffee and the afternoon sherry, and were surprised by a piano player on Friday nite. The cable car stop was 1/2 block away and restaurants were easily walking distance. Our room was actually larger than we expected with closet space for 3 people. All in all, a pleasurable experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge was not too helpful
review.locationRemarks: Everything was close by.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: As usual the room is not exactly as depicted but still it was still adequate considering the price of hotels in SanFran in that location. The front desk staff were professional and courteous and the cleaning staff were delightful. The hotel itself is charming and full of character while the rooms are comfortable offering a sanctuary from the busy life at street level. While there are many wonderful dining and entertainment options close at hand venturing a bit further on any of the public transit options offers a vast array of dining and entertainment to temp and sustain almost any desire.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Union Square, Bart and Muni.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby use a bit of a makeover.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is a short walk to the Bart and connection to SFO. As well the Muni buses and Cable car are just outside.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Very positice experience. It was a breif - one night stay but I would stay there again in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: quaint, great location, very clean - overall A+
review.negativeRemarks: The carpet did not look fresh in the room otherwise, the rest of the hotel was charming.

review.title: Decent hotel in a convenient location
review.reviewText: We ended up checking in a bit later than intended. Having read the reviews, we asked for a room facing away from Post St but the only available room was beside the elevator so we settled for the room facing Post St on the 8th floor. The first night, there were a lot of noise from the street (traffic and jazz music) so we requested a couple of pairs of ear plugs. The following morning, we opened the window because the room got really hot but when we tried to close it later, the window wouldn't close. The front desk sent us someone who merely closed the window shut with force. We never tried to open the window afterwards. The good thing was that I was able to close the window completely and the noise from the street was greatly minimized on subsequent nights. The hotel is old, the standard room is small and could use some updates and minor fixing (like the window and bathroom tiles) but it's half a block from Union Square, which make it an ideal stay for someone who isn't going to spend a lot of time at the hotel. The bed/pillow were comfortable and linen decent so after a long day of exploring the city, if you are tired and have a pair of ear plugs, you are good to go.
review.negativeRemarks: Window, bathroom tiles, air conditioning
review.locationRemarks: cable cars, union square, shopping district

review.title: Charming character, friendly, great location!
review.reviewText: We were pleasantly surprised with regards to the location, i.e. proximity to Union Square. Although our first night was noisy due to neighborhood construction, other nights were fine and staff was willing to move us to another room. We were there for 5 nights. Morning coffee was delicious; sherry hour is a nice touch with live music. Adjoining restaurant, Farallon, was amazing with the best happy hour food!!
review.positiveRemarks: Character, clean, location, great morning coffee.
review.negativeRemarks: Could see it being hot in Summer.
review.locationRemarks: At Union Square so ALL is nearby : stores, restaurants, tours, cable cars, Chinatown and more!

review.title: Valet was horrible
review.reviewText: Valet parking was horrible. They suggest that you call 20 mins before you come down. We did and when we got down there we had to wait 20 more minutes. The walls were thin in the rooms, and no air conditioner. But, over all I slept like a baby and I was right in union square.

review.title: Review
review.reviewText: Very nice.....hotel staff was exceptionally polite and accommodating.
review.positiveRemarks: The charming room and old world style. Close to a lot of things.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator to be repaired
review.locationRemarks: Cable car close....restaurants. Walking distance to china town, North Beach, etc.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel close to Union Square and public transport. I would recommend it to everyone.

review.title: Night in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is perfect! The rooms and clean and quiet and they right in the middle of the city!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: The proximity to downtown and price are excellent!
review.locationRemarks: You can shop downtown, grab a cable car, eat at one of the many yummy restaurants nearby, go see a play or walk up our famous hills!

review.title: Charming with a great location
review.reviewText:
The location is amazing. It's walking distance to everything. Morton's Steakhouse is right next door, Sacs, h&m, Victoria's Secret and Seven Jeans are within a block. Plenty of healthy places to eat, jog and have fun.

The staff was pleasent enough. I do have to say the valet was RUDE. For a guy working for tips, he didn't act like it. The front desk staff was very accommodating and friendly. They helped me print tickets, checked me in with ease and were all smiles. The maids were adorable. One complimented me on my purse and it was just so sweet.

The hotel itself is so charming. Very Art Deco 1920 charm. Love it. The room had amazing decor. It felt like a lot of thought was put into the design. The bathroom had lotion, shampoo and conditioner. Really nice to have. The bed was comfortable. If you get a room by the street, it's a little noisey, but I was presented with the option of street or rear room so I chose it!

They serve sherry in the lobby 4-6 and tea in the morning. A lovely touch!!

I would definitely return. The one reason it didn't get that extra star is that when you stay at the Hilton anywhere, they give you a fresh cookie when you check in. That's 5 stars.

review.title: No AC!
review.reviewText: My experience at Kensington Park was pleasant. Because the weather was mild, leaving the window open was sufficient to keep the room cool, but it would have been uncomfortable had the temperature been any warmer. That said, everything was clean, and the location was great. Very close to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade to AC.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText:
Great location- right near union square.

parking is just as bad as everyone says. i didn't have a problem dropping off my car, however, it did take 45 minutes to retrieve it. I called 30 minutes before I had planned to depart and when I arrived at the front desk I was told they needed another 10-15 minutes. ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS! Especially considering when my car was taken from me, the valet arrived back at the front desk before I had even finished checking in! So I know my car wasn't far! LOL...

Room was very comfortable and spacious. I'd definitely stay again, but would self-park next time!
review.negativeRemarks: VALET!
review.locationRemarks: Everything :)

review.title: The location is good.
review.reviewText:
One lift couldn't be used during my stay because it was out of order or something.
The location is good.

review.title: Quality Linens, best sleep :)
review.reviewText:
Great Location, walk to anywhere.
Clean and newly renovated with the most comfortable bed and
sheets ever! I usually only stay at Marriott, but decided to try the Kensington,
glad I did, now it will be where I stay when in SanFran.
Staff was informative about what to do and great restaurants! ;)
review.negativeRemarks: ummmmm.....hmmmmmmm....... can't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: right in Union Square. Literaly walk out the door, Art Galleries, Restaurants, shopping, Cable Car , Trolly,

review.title: Awesome location and sweet hotel!
review.reviewText: Took our family of four to SF. Stayed at the Kensington for two nights, went to the SF Playhouse to see Storefront Church...amazing! Shopped in union square, ice skated and took the trolley to the wharf, ate at Castagnolia's, yum! My daughters went to Cirque De Solie , I had a drink with my two high school friends at the Waterbar and them met my family at The Farralone for a late seafood dinner. The restaurant was stunning! We had a fabulous time together:)

review.title: Nice location for trip!
review.reviewText:
Staff and location is very nice! I was check-in staff 'Gloria' She was very kind. Location is really good. You can go to the Union Square only 1min walking!
Room is big just using one people. Not fridge. Not wardrobe. You can using the dresser.
review.locationRemarks: Yes

review.title: Nice location for trip!
review.reviewText:
Staff and location is very nice! I was check-in staff 'Gloria' She was very kind. Location is really good. You can go to the Union Square only 1min walking!
Room is big just using one people. Not fridge. Not wardrobe. You can using the dresser.

review.title: Nice hotel in convenient location
review.reviewText: Stayed for 4 nights in December, nice cozy feeling, very close to Union Square and Chinatown. We did not have a car but it was very easy to get around using transit since the hotel was close to various train stations and bus stops. Rooms are on the small side but adequate. For the price, I think it is a pretty good deal.
review.positiveRemarks: Free coffee in the morning, is surprisingly good quality!

review.title: Perfect room for an overnight getaway!
review.reviewText: Hotel is older and beautiful. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Location is amazing. Great prices for the quality.
review.positiveRemarks: Character of hotel is classy and beautiful.
review.locationRemarks: Location was amazing....too many things to do to count.
Can't beat the location--heart o' Union Square, close to Chinatown, Financial District, etc.

review.title: Wonderful staff - great location
review.reviewText: Excellent location, near shopping, food and many transportation options. The hotel was clean and comfortable and the staff was great. The hotel is older but that added to its charm. Would definitely stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Double pane glass to block out street noise

review.reviewText: We were warmly greeted when we checked in and everything was as expected. When you consider the price, this place matches any place in town.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: My husband and I went to San Francisco for the weekend and stayed at the Kensington Park Hotel at Union Square. The location was close to the public transportation which is how we were getting around as well as good places to eat. The room was very comfortable with a really nice bed and free Wi-Fi which was nice. The staff was always very friendly and checking in and out was very quick with no hassles. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: We like the overall comfort of the room, the free Wi-Fi and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: The tv listings provided in the room do not match the actual tv channels. The height of the bathroom sink and counter space, there really is not any.
review.locationRemarks: The location was close to the public transportation and easy to navigate. There were plenty of places to eat and shop.

review.title: Spacious Room for SF
review.reviewText: My room was clean and very spacious for San Francisco. If you need a nice lobby to hang out it then this is not the hotel for you. No restaurant and the lobby is dreary, but my room was nice, clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly. If you are a light sleeper then you need to be in a room away from the main road.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location. Right off of Union Square for shopping and an easy walk to Moscone Center if you are in SF for a conference.

review.title: Nice rooms and centrally located
review.reviewText: Rooms are nice, but a bit small, but sufficient. This is to be expected in an older hotel in SF. Since we are not in our rooms much, except to sleep, this works for us. My only complaint was that the doors slammed when closed. There is no way to lift the handle or turn the knob. So if you have someone that stays up late or gets up earlier, you might be awakened. The staff was wonderful, hotel in a wonderful location. Parking is an extra $40 - 45/ for a 24 hour period. This includes as many in and outs as you want. You never see the valet, so there is no tipping. Price includes all. I thought this wouldn't work well, but it did. There are cheaper parking around, but they do not include the in and out option. Ask for room 78. It is a corner room and overlooks part of Union Square. It is on the 11th floor so is as quiet as any room can be in that area of SF. We would stay here again.

review.title: Convenient location, excellent price, but noisy
review.reviewText: Extremely conveniently located to union square shopping, there's also a cute cafe next door with reasonably priced fare. Very friendly staff. Room was clean, though some of the finishes (trim paint, bath fixtures) show signs of wear. The price I paid was fantastic for a downtown location. My biggest complaint was that the room was a bit noisy at night. Upgraded windows, double-layer curtains, or even complimentary ear plugs would help considerably. If you aren't disturbed by the noise, I'd recommend it. I would stay there again, regardless. The price and cleanliness were spot-on.

review.title: Nice older hotel near Union Square
review.positiveRemarks: Attractive boutique hotel. Room was pleasant and the bed was very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was hot and we couldn't turn the heat down. Didn't want to open the window because of the street noise.
review.locationRemarks: Great location! Half block from the cable car and all the stores around Union Square. Had drinks in the Farallon bar and steak dinner at Morton's.

review.title: Nice hotel with a great location
review.positiveRemarks: It was a good hotel. We were near elevators but didn't hear a thing. Decent view. Afternoon Sherry was nice. Great location!
review.locationRemarks: 1/2 block from cable cars, hop-on-bus across the street, 1/2 block from Union Square and shopping district, walking distance to trolleys.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Centrally located, excellent helpful staff. Great restaurant and saw a wonderful play on site.

review.title: Great Union Square location!!
review.reviewText:
If you do not want to climb the hills of San Fran then stay at the Kensington Park it is a great location and close to trolley. Hotel is clean and comfy. The staff was the most impressive meeting every need that we had with directions and even making reservations at a local favorite (Fino)
I would stay at this hotel again

review.title: I had a great stay at Kensington
review.reviewText: The staff is friendly and helpful. I asked what was good locally and they gave me great options. I will stay there the next time I visit San Francisco.

review.title: Lovely Hotel--great location
review.reviewText: The staff was professional, friendly. Lovely hotel, nice comfortable room. Great location.
review.locationRemarks: Great location--right at Union Square

review.title: Location, Cleanliness and Comfort
review.reviewText: The Kensington Park Hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Union Square, which is close to most tourist attractions and a cheap $9.00 cab ride to everything else. The hotel is very unique, housing a theatre on second floor. It is extremely mysterious looking and you may feel you are in an 1980's thriller film, as the hallways reminded me of The Shining, but the staff are super friendly, the hotel is spotless, and the beds are ultra comfortable. The rooms are really big and you will love how quiet is it. I recommend it to anyone staying in San Francisco. It is also priced well.

review.title: Close to Union Square.
review.reviewText:
Older hotel, but interesting architecture in lobby. Close to shopping, good food, and cable car stop. If you like to walk, China Town and North Beach are several blocks away. Rooms updated, clean, and comfortable. but not plush. Staff friendly and helpful.
Drawbacks: No room safe and a little street noise early AM. Would stay again.

review.title: Wonderful stay!
review.reviewText:
We had a wonderful stay at Kensington Park Hotel and thoroughly enjoyed the afternoon sherry.

The hotel staff were marvelous, every one of them.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom counter space in Rm. 84 was insufficient.
review.locationRemarks: The close proximity to Union Square and public transportation was perfect for us, as was the local dining opportunities.

review.title: Union square hotel
review.reviewText: Had a very nice stay at the Kensington. The street side is a bit noisy, but not bad enough to have me not go back.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is steps away. So much to do and see in the entire area.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText:
Upon our early arrival the staff was accommodating and understanding keeping our luggage for a few hours in their closet (Bob was very sweet)

The room was clean, it didn't have a safe, and the bathroom only had one small soap. The cleaning staff was polite. Overall the hotel is a good option if you looking for a place in central San Francisco to rest at night.

review.title: Great location, warm service
review.reviewText: We stayed recently for a short getaway vacation with kids. The location couldn't be better, with just a short walk to BART, cable car and Hop-On-Hop-Off tour buses, not to mention its centrality to all kinds of shopping and dining choices. The hotel itself has a lot of old charms and characters, being right on top of San Francisco Playhouse, a vintage theatre. The hotel staff, especially the concierge, are very hospitable and responsive. The room is a bit small but expected in such a premium location. The beds are very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Would be nice to have a safe in the room
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is but a few hundred yards away, lots of great shopping all around. There are a few great dining choices within just a couple of blocks.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Hotel was really nice, very good location but a little small for 4 people. Still a very good hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: the location and staff was nice and helpful
review.locationRemarks: lots of shopping and near the cable cars.

review.title: Nice hotel, very noisy on street side
review.reviewText:
Nice older hotel, great location near Union Square. Very noisy if you are unfortunate to have a room on the street side. Very hot unless you open the windows, which of course you don't want to do because the street noise is very disrupting (we didn't see air conditioning, just a ceiling fan). The windows are not very insulated and do not do a great job of keeping out the street noise.
Bottom line, ask for a courtside room, unless you are a very deep sleeper!
Otherwise this is a nice hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Better windows to keep street noise out. If air conditioning was available, it was not obvious to us. Better signage?

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Good location, comby beds, don't worry about no air conditioning it's not needed.

review.title: A hotel with Character
review.reviewText:
The positives are that the Kensington is definitely in the heart of the city; easily accessible to all the major tourist attractions and transportation; and the hotel itself has a lot of character. Definitely a nice location for those travellers who like to look for food, entertainment and other "amenities" outside of the hotel itself.

The negatives is that there is no air conditioning in the rooms and we would rather not have had to use the ceiling fan while we sleep. Also, it's difficult for us to sleep with street light and noise coming from outside our sixth floor window. Apparently night entertainers enjoy playing their saxophone until 11pm and city garbage trucks do their 'pickup and compacting' between the hours of 1 and 4am a few times a week. Unfortunately, the 'compacting' sounds like concrete being broken. We weren't impressed.

review.title: Comfortable room - excellent location
review.reviewText:
I was very pleased with this hotel. The location was excellent - 30 second walk and you're in Union Sq with all its shops and the trolley stops.
The hotel lobby is very pretty and the rooms were spacious and in good condition - shower worked well. There was very little noise in the night from the road or the hotel corridor.
There was free coffee and juice available in the mornings.
Overall I was really pleased and felt it was good value for money and would happily return there.

review.title: Pleasant hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Hotel was well located if you want to be near Union Square and shopping but in hindsight should have booked around Fishermans Wharf. It's close to a cable car stop, has some restaurants nearby and cafes for breakfast are good. Nice restaurant around the corner called Sears that served nice food with friendly staff and good prices.

Like all San Francisco accommodation it is over priced. Small bathroom that needed a bit of updating.

review.title: Union Square - Great Location
review.reviewText: We picked this hotel for it location. Close to all the things we wanted to have access to ie cable cars, hop-on hop-off buses, restaurants and shops
review.negativeRemarks: Without A/C we had the windows open and the noise from the street - trumpet player, delivery and garbage pick up through the night was disturbing.
review.locationRemarks: Great Location, friendly staff and nice atmosphere.

review.title: San Francisco - 4 night stay
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Kensington Park Hotel for 4 nights, it was ideally located for us. The room was clean and spacious.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal to get to shopping, Chinatown and other key sights

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
I assumed this hotel was a little further from Union Square but actually it's just around the corner. The welcome was friendly and we were encouraged to have a back room to avoid the sound from the street but the view would be a brick wall (hmm).

The hotel is old but the best has been made of the rooms. The bathroom has a low level old tub with what might be original plumbing - quaint really.

The drinks invitation in the evening is cheap sweet sherry or water.

The lobby is faux medieval with access to the restaurant next door or the theatre also located in the same building.
review.positiveRemarks: Location close to train, bus, tram and shops. If you have a dog they have a bowl of water and food for the pet.
review.negativeRemarks: Reception style but that is a personal thing....

review.title: Great Choice of Hotel!
review.reviewText: Excellent location for cable car, bus routes and shopping. The hotel was clean and comfortable; the staff was pleasant and helpful; the tea and sherry in the lobby in the afternoon was appreciated. I would highly recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The phone had to be fixed, but the hotel absorbed the long distance charges I incurred and one day, the wake-up call was not received.
review.locationRemarks: near the cable car, a great deal of shopping one block away, and a 10 min walk to major bus routes :to the Ferry Building, to the Wharf,etc

review.title: Great Location, and Friendly staff
review.reviewText: Great Location, and very helpful and Friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: Central location near Union Square

review.title: Great location but service lacking
review.reviewText:
We got to the hotel late at night and the person working the front desk was not organized and lacked knowledge of the area. The concierge the first day was not overly friendly, but his counterpart on Friday was very helpful. The room itself is cozy, but we found many surfaces had not been dusted very well. The location of the hotel is great and is very close to Powell Station which is a transportation hub. You are a short cable car from Fishermans Wharf and can walk to many restaurants.

We are not high-demanding travellers, but felt the service at the hotel could use some improvement. The hotel should consider offering a reception in the lobby with wine served instead of sherry as many other hotels in the area offer local wines.
review.negativeRemarks: Service and cleanliness of rooms. Although the dusty surfaces could have been random. Offer a wine reception in the main lobby instead of sherry.

review.title: NOISY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: very noisy didnt sleep for 4 nights cause we had to keep window open a little because nor air and it was too hot . garbage pick up was at very noisy at 4 am in morning would never stay there again !!!!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: some air
review.locationRemarks: shopping

review.title: Close to shops
review.reviewText: Short distance to union square, hotel staff friendly and helpful
review.locationRemarks: Uniom square, cable cars

review.title: Central location, access to public transportation
review.reviewText:
Front desk/conscierge staff was helpful and accommodating.

Room was clean and adequate. Would really have liked to have a fridge in the room,however, hunting for ice from a different floor became a drag after a few days. Also surprised that the room did not have a safe - that is pretty much a staple in hotels of this caliber.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful front office staff. Good location w. access to public transportation
review.negativeRemarks: See above. Also, had some difficulty in finding an electric outlet to recharge phone in the beginning.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, dining, Chinatown, Little Saigon, cable cars, museums.....

review.title: Nice hotel - very central. Staff very helpful.
review.reviewText: Good hotel close to Chinatown and main shops - easy access to trams and buses. Only draw back is the number of homeless people in central SF - which is not the hotel's fault I guess!
review.negativeRemarks: For the cost - they could have included free continental breakfast!
review.locationRemarks: Near Chinatown, main shops, Westfield, MoMA (had it been open) - easy access to trams, buses etc. Keep away from Tenderloin district, not nice!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great stay. No breakfast provided other than coffee and juice, but there are very good places close to get breakfast (Honey Honey). The staff is friendly and the hotel is in an excellent location. We will certainly consider it on our next visit.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel should offer suggestions on sites and food. A good staff, but quiet staff.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square and many restaurants.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great staff and location,room okay but bathroom could be smarter. Tiles broken and worn taps
review.negativeRemarks: It would be good if there was continental breakfast

review.title: Hotel Staff
review.reviewText: My recent stay was incredible! The staff was AWESOME and the location was the best. Not to close in the tourist area but not to far away. I highly recommend a stay and Vincent at the front desk was great and very helpful!

review.title: Charming hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Overall experience was pleasant, just had issues with the air conditioning but is not really need it in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning and internet access in the room
review.locationRemarks: The location is great if you are planning to do shopping and visit downtown. Amazing steakhouse next door.

review.title: Great Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: First visit to SF, hotel was easy to find and staff were brilliant in providing us local information, maps etc. The room was not air-conditioned which made it a little uncomfortable for three adults and one child (11yrs) overnight, but we managed okay. Can be a little noisy if facing the street but we were so tired most nights didn't notice so much. Would recommend ensuring keys are coded fresh when checking in (it seems ours was not and someone managed to open the door while we were in the room disappearing quickly when they realised the room was still occupied - the staff were great and immediately provided fresh key cards with new codes. Not sure what would have happened had we not been in the room at the time though). Despite this hiccup I would still recommend this hotel, location is fabulous and staff were terrific.
review.negativeRemarks: Security - ensuring all rooms and key cards are given fresh codes with new arrivals
review.locationRemarks: This is right on Union Square with easy access to two Cable Car lines and all things shopping!!

review.title: Unique hotel in a good downtown location.
review.reviewText: Interesting hotel with a special charm but a little bit dated in all respects.
review.negativeRemarks: Technology.

review.title: Excellent location in union square
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Kensington Park Hotel for a week. Our first time visiting San Fran and enjoyed the the whole experience of the City and sites. The staff at the KPH was amazing, kind, thoughtful and always accommodating. Thank you to Gloria, Rueben and Bob who made our stay enjoyable and down to earth.
review.positiveRemarks: What was most interesting was the staff at the KPH....whatever was needed was always fulfilled with promptness and kindness.
review.locationRemarks: The location of the hotel was perfect, near shopping, transit, restaurants and site seeing.

review.title: Private get-a-way
review.reviewText: First, I arrived really really early and was given a room right then with no extra charge. The staff was very nice and not the fake nice, they seemed like normal nice people. The room was orderly and complete (much nice than other hotels I have stayed in SF for many more $$$$$). The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was sufficient and overall my room was CLEAN. Lastly, I had a wonderful time for a great price, will definitely stay in another personality hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom sink in insanely low, maybe in time raise it higher.
review.locationRemarks: It's near everything (short walk or muni ride away).

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: older hotel could use updating but plenty of charm. location is excellent right in union square. no ac but ceiling fan kept room comfortable esp since nights are cool. Staff friendly & helpfull We had noisy ceiling fan and were moved to another room with no issues. street side noisy but manageable. Great value!
review.negativeRemarks: general upgrades
review.locationRemarks: steps from union square, cable cars, shopping etc

review.title: Cute hotel, great location.
review.reviewText:
My boyfriend and I took a recent trip to San Francisco for a couple of days and chose the Kensington based on the location and reviews we read online. The staff was great, very accommodating and very knowledgeable. Our flight landed very early in the morning so we went to the hotel and were able to store our bags while we walked around the city a bit. When we returned we were able to check into our room (hours before the normal check-in time).

The room was small but not tiny, something you would expect in an older hotel. But the bed was comfortable and I didn't feel squished by any means. Our room even came with a fridge which we were excited about so we could pack little lunches for our wine country excursion!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location within walking distance to the Powell BART stop and to the Trolley line that takes you to Fisherman's Wharf. Safe area.
review.locationRemarks: We did an Edible Excursions walking tour and a Muir Woods/Wineries tour from Extranomical Tours. Both were fantastic and highly recommended!

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText:
Booked this hotel based off of the reviews on Expedia. I have to say that for the price, we were expecting a better hotel -- bigger room, bigger bed, bigger hotel. I'm not saying that the room wasn't great, it was just smaller than we expected when paying the same price for rooms in other cities. Kensington Park Hotel is right across from the Westin St. Francis. Being the curious beings that we are, we decided to check out the prices for a similar room at the Westin and BOY did we realize how great of a price we paid for Kensington, with it being such a great location.

Service at the front desk was exceptional. Everyone was very friendly and helpful to our questions about tourism in San Fran. Also, the sherry water was fantastic! So refreshing and cute!

Oh one thing before I forget. There is no air conditioning in the rooms. I repeat. NO AIR CONDITIONING. But there is a ceiling fan. And it was enough to keep all of 4 of us cool throughout the night.

Overall, a very quaint and nicely decorated hotel. I will stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room!
review.locationRemarks: AMAZING. So close to Market St. for great shopping.

review.title: older hotel with character.
review.reviewText: Lovely older hotel with character. Good location. Would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful experience. The staff goes above and beyond. The concierge was extremely helpful.

review.title: Perfectly located for city explorers
review.reviewText: This is a very conveniently located hotel, less than a block from Union Square but just enough to be away from the noise & bustle (we had a room at the rear, which probably helped). The hotel is very comfortable, the wifi worked really well and staff were courteous and helpful. It would have been nice if the shower was more powerful.
review.negativeRemarks: The shower

review.title: Location location location
review.reviewText:
Great location. Near anlotbof shopping, restaurants and transportation.
Well worth the money. Would stay again.

review.title: Cozy room.
review.reviewText: We stayed in a room with a view, but without the street noise. It was a small, but cozy. The bathroom was nice. There wasn't any room service. We were located right next to Union Square. We could walk anywhere. Restaurants, stores and lots of shopping. Nice place. I would stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: It was in a great location.
review.negativeRemarks: To have room service to be a little more available. I asked for a pitcher of water and the guy at the desk said there is bottled water. ($3)
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, shopping, shopping, and more shopping!!!

review.title: Nice hotel just steps from union square.
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was nice and clean. The coffee in the morning and tea or sherry in the afternoon was wonderful.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice clean room. Can't beat the location. The San Francisco playhouse is on the second floor of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is about 1/2 block away. The show we saw at the playhouse was fantastic.

review.title: Kensington Park Hotel
review.reviewText: When we arrive we found that the toilets has not been cleaned. We called room service which took care of it quickly. Parts of the room such as furniture and corners could use a little refreshment with a paint job.
review.negativeRemarks: The old style building a smelling a little musky.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, very handy to shops and Union Square just a block away.

review.title: Great location in Downtown area
review.reviewText: Convenient location to all modes of transportation and walking distance to China Town, theaters & all levels of dining experiences
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was great, room/ bed very comfortable. Clean, good location
review.negativeRemarks: Water temp. in shower was at times hard to regulate, but might be due to plumbing down the hall. Need more Cable access on TV / safe in room & Fridge
review.locationRemarks: Right by all major shopping, China Town, Cable Car, Metro, near Market Street to access all bus routes. Whatever type of food you wanted it was nearby

review.title: Friendly staff, great location
review.reviewText: Quick weekend trip...found the hotel on Expedia and it was as described. A little older but well kept. The staff was helpful and friendly even before I arrived by providing tips on how to get to the hotel from the airport. The beds are comfortable. The afternoon tea and sherry was a nice touch.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very helpful, friendly and accommodating. The location was right in Union Square close to fantastic shopping. The bed was comfy.
review.negativeRemarks: The doors slam loudly. Starting around 7 a.m. Fixing the doors to close quietly would make this hotel a gem.
review.locationRemarks: Located right in Union Square walking distance to great shopping and public transportation. There's a theater in the hotel.

review.title: Charming place
review.reviewText: Travelling by my own was really looked after. Arrived exhausted and was placed in a quiet room so could rest. Location is brilliant and so close to the shops and restaurants. Having the San Fran playhouse in the building was a major plus as was having Farrallon next door. Can't speak high enough about The Kensington was just a beautiful place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: The lifts took ages but it added to the charm
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Close to everything downtown.Quiet
review.reviewText: The employees are the best! very helpful from getting settled to suggestions for dinner and sight seeing. very happy with our stay!
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, but still in the middle of things.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is near by...shopping, dining and transportation.

review.title: Nice hotel close to shopping
review.reviewText: The hotel was easy to find, in the heart of the shopping district. The size of the room was nice for a downtown hotel. My only problem is the constant noise the wind and cable cars make its very annoying for a light sleeper such as myself. My BF had no problems sleeping. The free WIFI is great. It was a great place to stay on our short getaway.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very nice, location was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Better windows for those rooms that are stuck looking at the ugly veiw in the back of the hotel. The sound that is created in that area is annoying.
review.locationRemarks: Tons of shopping Saks, Neimans, Westfield Shopping Mall and tons of other stores.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location, but very noisy
review.reviewText: It was a wonderful experience. The hotel staff were excellent and very helpful. The downside was that there is road construction two blocks away and they work 24 hours a day ......the hotel being older, one could hear the construction noise during night hours

review.title: Great location but not a great hotel!
review.reviewText: I spent five nights at the Kensington. All of the staff were very pleasant, and the location was great! Being next to the Farallon restaurant was a big plus with their incredible seafood menu! From there it all goes downhill with the dingy lighting in the bath room, chipped paint on the walls and baseboard from being hit too many times by hotel staff from vacuuming, and dirty windows. There was no way to control the temperature of the room other than opening the windows! The bed was not especially comfortable, and the blanket looked like it had just come from the thrift shop and placed on the bed! Limited TV stations and lots of street noise at 2 am ! I won't be back.
review.positiveRemarks: hotel staff and their great location
review.negativeRemarks: a major redo and some serious cleaning! New mattresses and bedding!

review.title: Character, comfortable, close to public transit.
review.reviewText: We stayed 5 nights and was most enjoyable. 1/2 block from Union Square and close to all public transportation. Very reasonable rates for where you are in San Francisco and the convenience of shopping, dining and transportation. Lots of people in the area, even late, and always felt safe. Staff was always very helpful for directions using the transit system to all tourist locations and dining recommendations. Check in/out was very efficiently handled with no surprises. Older building with lots of character. Bathroom was a little small, but comes with older building, though could use a little updating but otherwise very comfortable. Ceiling fan and open window made for a very comfortable room climate in late July with San Francisco weather. Complimentary tea and sherry in the late afternoon was a nice feature. Overall a very enjoyable experience that I will recommend to friends.

review.title: We loved the old feel!!
review.reviewText: We loved the old hotel with the updated rooms. The beds were so comfortable and being able to have fresh air through the windows was great!! The connsieurrs(spelled wrong)...Rueben and Bob were so much help!! We will definitely want to stay here next time. I loved how close it was to Union square, the cable cars, the bus!
review.negativeRemarks: A little morning breakfast would be nice but I loved going out for breakfast too.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, China town is close, the theatre we went to was 1 block away. Fine dining and cheaper dining within the 1/2 block!!

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText:
Centrally located and very near Union Square. Lori's Diner on Sutter and Powell is an ideal place for breakfast. Daily Grill and The Cheesecake Factory both good too.

The hotel s what I'd called faded grandeur and is extremely comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: No bar
review.locationRemarks: On street off Union Square

review.title: Quirky hotel, great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is located right near Union Square and is convenient to shopping, restaurants, and transportation to tourist sites. The lobby is rather small and dated and there's an Elks Club and theater in the building, so you see people coming and going in the evening, but the rooms have been renovated and are very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful during our stay. Sherry in the afternoon was a nice touch, but the morning coffee was undrinkable!
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, comfortable room, great location
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby could be brightened up a bit and a.m. coffee could be better.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square shopping, restaurants, BART and Powell Street streetcar. Some museums (Contemporary Jewish Museum) and parks are walking distance.

review.title: Central union square location
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. The historical building, fixtures, our room with a comfy king size bed and staff was so friendly and helpful. Would come back anytime.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. I love historical hotels with lots of character
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shopping right down the straight. Only 1 mile to ferry building or north beach

review.title: corner room with beautiful views
review.reviewText: Staff called all 4 of us by name every time we passed them.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful corner room views of Nob Hill and Union Square.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, China Town and Mortons very close.

review.title: delightful hotel
review.reviewText: Kensington Park hotel did not disappoint. It's situated in a great location, just meters from Union Square and all its department stores and restaurants. The front desk staff and housekeeping were excellent and very helpful, particularly Bob the concierge who has an intimate knowledge of San Francisco and all it has to offer. The beds were very comfortable and we really liked it's old world charm. We will definitely be back again.
review.positiveRemarks: The view over Union Square, free wi-fi, great beds.
review.negativeRemarks: The city can be noisy late at night
review.locationRemarks: excellent, couldn't get better.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: This staff is very helpful and kind at the Kensington. The concierge (Giovanni?) gave us some great unique ideas of things to do, and wonderful restaurant suggestions. Our room was very quiet, and the bed was very comfortable. We paid to upgrade to a larger room with a bigger window that had a great view, as well as a larger bathroom with more counter space. It was worth it. Wasn't the most luxurious of bathrooms, however for the little time we spent in our room, and how pleased we were with everything else, it was easy to overlook.

review.title: Wonderful hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Loved the "old world" charm of the hotel. Sherry and music in the evenings. Great staff!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Vacation in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in the heart of the city with a system of public transportation that is excellent and allow you to see all the beautiful attractions in the city
review.negativeRemarks: About some beagles for the morning coffee
review.locationRemarks: Great location, beautiful park nearby and great public transportation

review.title: More than just comfort- an experience!
review.reviewText: The overall service and quality is what one would expect from a downtown/centrally located hotel. The most highlighted positive is the decor and atmosphere. From the grand piano with the occasional pianist to the old world decor. You feel transported to the old-time San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor is so inspiring and feels historical. Room was very quiet and comfortable- slept like a baby! Wifi included.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi was a little slow, although was plenty for my needs.
review.locationRemarks: Very central! No shortage of restaurants and retail within walking distance. SF has amazing food!

review.title: Perfect location.
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time. The hotel is very nice, staff was kind and courteous. A nice change from the big chains.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel near Union Square and Cable Cars
review.reviewText: The Kensington Park Hotel is a beautiful hotel connected to the San Francisco playhouse and is modeled after it. The rooms are a good size and are quite charming. From the hotel, you're right next to Union Square and a cable car stop that can take you straight to Fisherman's Wharf. It's also a very inexpensive Uber ride to almost anywhere in the city. It's also only a few blocks from the Union Square BART stop, so you can save some money on travel to and from the airport. It's in the perfect location to go to brunch and explore in the morning and afternoon, come back to nap, and go out for the evening.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, extremely comfortable, affordable, great bang for your buck
review.negativeRemarks: TV channels
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Cable Cars, shopping, restaurants

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: An excellent location around Union Square, the hotel looks a bit tired, however, considering the price this hotel provides good value. Advice from the front desk was always spot on and dependable. No Breakfast included, however the front desk recommended a local restaurant which was wonderful.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Hop on Off Buses, cable cars and local transport... shopping Macys, Saks etc

review.title: Convenient to shopping, food, and attractions
review.reviewText: The hotel was comfortable and conveniently located to everything.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, attentiveness of staff, tea service.
review.negativeRemarks: The TV reception
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, restaurants, transit services

review.title: Good location to union square
review.reviewText:
My experience is based on one night. The room was clean and the beds very confortable.
It was a little roomier than I expected since it is San Francisco and rooms are usually very small. The decor was very nice eclectic. It is connected to a theater so there will be theater goers in the lobby or the elevators. A great perk was the free wifi. Another issues parking it was one time $40 valet parking for 24 hrs. One complaint is that one of the receptionist was kind of hard to understand because of her Asian decent accent.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking situation.
review.locationRemarks: Ruby Sky is near by and lots of little boutiques. For sure union square.

review.title: Great great great
review.reviewText: Great location, great staff, very friendly and helpful, great hotel!
review.locationRemarks: Very central, right where you want to be

review.title: Kensington Park Hotel
review.reviewText: We spent 3 nights at the Kensington Park Hotel and we would definitely stay again. The staff was incredibly attentive and very helpful. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. I loved the location; BART was just down the street. At nights, we would take a trolley car home from Ghirardelli Square and it would drop us off at the corner of the street out hotel was on. We would stay here again next time we come to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, China Town, Market Street, BART.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText:
My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel June 4th 2013 - June 9th 2013. The staff were always friendly and helpful. My girlfriend is extremely picky about cleanliness and her biggest worry is any form of bed bugs etc. Needless to say, she did not have a single complaint. Our room was definitely free of all forms of any kind of insect and the cleanliness was always maintained by the hotel staff. On our next visit to SF we will 100% return to the Kensington Park Hotel. I would recommend it moreover due to its excellent location (right beside Union Square/5 minute walk from both Westfield and Chinatown/right beside all significant bus and cable car routes), price and atmosphere.
The only downfall was unavoidable street noise from approximately 8-11 every night.
review.negativeRemarks: Some street noise.
review.locationRemarks: Near all significant bus stops, town centers and shopping centers.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Great location downtown and clean room. Outdated and in need of lobby and bathroom remodel.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom. Small and in need of remodel
review.locationRemarks: Very central.

review.title: Classy hotel in great location
review.reviewText: The Kensington is a hotel with character, in a great location, close to fabulous shopping, a huge variety of restaurants, theatre, and all means of transportation to check out all the other great attractions available in San Francisco. The rooms are lovely, the staff are very attentive and helpful. My whole experience at the Kensington Park was terrific and I would gladly stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The character of the hotel, the location, the service from the staff
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy hallway
review.locationRemarks: Right off Union Square so has great access to shopping, a variety of restaurants, and transportation including trolley cars!

review.title: Overall very good hotel
review.reviewText:
I stayed here for 4 nights in May 2013 - admittedly I didn't spend that much time at the hotel itself.

The location is 2 minutes walk form Union Square. The room was compact but large enough for 1 or 2 people (double bed) and was clean. It has a slightly old fashioned decor but doesn't seem run down. Staff are very helpful and are able to answer queries for tourists with ease. Overall, very good hotel with reasonable prices considering the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Gloomy lighting
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square

review.title: Clean, Great Location, Small Queen Beds
review.reviewText: Great, English-style hotel. Location is excellent in the heart of downtown San Fran. The staff is friendly and helpful. The only drawback is their queen bed size, it's smaller than queen beds of other hotels. Two people cannot sleep comfortably on it.

review.title: business trip
review.reviewText: best comfy bed ever! very good housekeeping staff. Lobby area could be kept tidier, but that is a small gripe, in general very good value and near all attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: untidy areas in lobby gave hotel an unkempt feel
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: No Air Conditioning
review.reviewText: The only thing that they don't tell you, or at least I didn't see in their description, was the lack of air conditioning. It wasn't an issue for me as I didn't visit during a hot spell. But, if it does get very warm, I think that hotel guests should know that there is only a fan above the bed.
review.positiveRemarks: Very friendly staff who were accommodating and willing to help with all of my needs.
review.negativeRemarks: There was no air conditioning and no pool.
review.locationRemarks: Great spot that is centrally located. You can jump on the cable car half a block away and go to Fisherman's Wharf for the day.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText:
The location of this hotel is great - less than a block off Union Square. Our room was decent size, with a king bed that was very comfortable. Considering that we were so close to the square, it was pretty quiet. And the bathroom was huge. The only lack was a fridge in the room. One elevator wasn't working when we arrived but by the next morning that was in order. Staff was helpful, both with the valet parking and getting us restaurant reservations.

There's tea and sherry in the afternoons, which is really nice after a long day of sightseeing.

There isn't a place to have breakfast in the hotel, but there are many decent cafes, diners and restaurants within a block or 2, so it's not a big lack.

I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Romantic, friendly, and a great location
review.reviewText:
We are in our late 40's as this was our honeymoon. Obviously we have traveled quite a bit at his point in our lives. We originally booked through a package deal and found the pricing to be very affordable. We did upgrade our room one week prior to going and the staff was more than helpful. When we arrived at the hotel we were met by the smiles and helpfulness of the entire staff. When we got to our room we found a printed card with our names engraved wishing us congratulations on our marriage. We also were given a complimentary bottle of wine. WOW !!
The bed was nice and the noise level not bad at all. We were on the 12th floor so that might have helped. We overlooked Union Square and it was spectacular. We truly enjoyed the soft trumpet at night coming from the corner of the square as it serenaded us to sleep each night. Truly a romantic setting.
The two concierge we dealt with were polite and very helpful. They were always available and led us to some truly fantastic places to eat. Their suggestions were spot on !!
review.positiveRemarks: Room, people, and location. Also the complimentary coffee and happy hour
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom was small...but hey you don't spend your vacation there anyway !!
review.locationRemarks: FANTASTIC !!!

review.title: Fabulous
review.reviewText: I love this hotel, as a single woman travelling alone I always feel safe.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cleanliness, friendly and helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Excellent - can walk to Ferry Buildings, right on Union Square

review.title: palace not place
review.reviewText: had an infant and was upgraded to the royal suite, super comfy bed, staff knew how best to treat us , many thanks

review.title: Amazing hotel!
review.reviewText: Amazing hotel, friendly staff and great location. Very clean and beautiful rooms

review.title: Classic hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in great location, would recommend without hesitation. Loved the decor. Staff very friendly and helpfull at at times.

review.title: A great 5 day experience!
review.reviewText:
I had never been to San Francisco before and was taking my friend for this trip as a gift for all her assistance at my workplace.
We had a great time and saw almost everything I think you can enjoy there. The staff was so helpful everytime we called on them, both for the best directions to places, opening our stuck winebottle, to printing out our flight tickets home. We do so appreciate the time and trouble to give us a geat room, which was cleaned while we were gone daily, but also at the end of the hotel which was quiet for sleeping. The fact that when I booked the room I was told that only a king sized bed was available for the entire week, but when we checked in, they gave us 2 double beds or 2 queens( not really sure which) for the entire stay. The location was also to our liking. We were close to almost everything by walking or public transportation, and Bob gave us ideas how to get there the fastest. All in all it was one of the best run trips, weather included, I have ever taken.
review.negativeRemarks: Had a little problem turning off the tub faucets, and they were out of orange juice both mornings I tried to have some.
review.locationRemarks: The trolley hop was right around the corner, and the bank was right there too. The Macy's was close, and we are at the Burger Bar and the Cheesecake

review.title: Very helpful Staff
review.reviewText: Staff were excellent and extremely helpful. Location was very handy to Union Square and transport. Free WiFi and internet access was a plus. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to friends.

review.title: Kensington Park Hotel - Great
review.reviewText: Thank you so much for this experience, I was totally happy with everything. will certainly user Expedia in future
review.positiveRemarks: This hotel is so close to Union Square and so very upmarket without the huge price, loved it!
review.negativeRemarks: The concierge was very helpful and all staff were attentive and understanding
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, what more can be said!

review.title: Very good hotel, would recommend it.
review.reviewText: Great location, close to union square and good transport. No breakfast but complimentary drinks at breakfast and tea time.

review.title: Nice Hotel - Great Location

Friendly, helpful staff. Room cleaned well every day. Comfortable bed. Great location just 1/2 block from Union Square.
Would recommend it to anyone

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Although the Kensington Park Hotel is an older style hotel it was clean and nice to stay in. Staff were always friendly and our stay was enjoyable

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly staff and nice clean rooms.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel Met and exceeded our expectations.it is a unique hotel in a great position with friendly staff

review.title: Haven of calm in heart of city
review.reviewText: The Kensington has such a calm atmosphere that just walking in the front entrance brings a feeling of wellbeing. The staff are genuinely friendly without being intrusive. It has an old fashioned charm but not in a twee way. Like many smaller SF hotels it doesn't have room service and we would have appreciated a small refrigerator in the room to keep milk cold. However there are plenty of reasonably priced cafes and diners not for away and some excellent restaurants.
review.locationRemarks: Walk up the hill to Sutter and Bush streets to find some nice restaurants and shops away from the Union Square bedlam

review.title: Great vibe
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel! It has a great vibe and an non-sterile environment. very enjoyable - we will return.

review.title: Great location, friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Great location. Great, friendly staff. The concierge was very helpful. Sherry and music in the afternoon was nice. It is noisy at night, I think because of 24 hour subway construction nearby. It didn't bother me-I expect noise when staying in a city. Farallon next door is a great place for seafood-wonderful bartenders.

review.title: Excellent for pets.
review.reviewText: It's a very cool old hotel. It has lot's of polished brass and charm. The carpets are a bit worn but clean. They had a water bowl and dog treats in the lobby. 1/2 block walk to grass. A very friendly environment.
review.negativeRemarks: The first floors that the rooms were on was the 5th. So, all walks required an elevator ride. No big deal, just be aware.

review.title: Polite and helpful

review.title: Great Hotel

review.title: Great location in SF

review.title: Good location, nice place
review.reviewText: Nice place, good location downtown. We liked the extras, like coffee and juice service on our floor each morning, as well as the sherry in the evening.

review.title: Great Union Square hotel for everyone.
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is very convenient to Union Square & Market St. Chinatown is within walking distance. The entire staff at the hotel are very friendly and made our stay like being with good friends. We arrived at the hotel at 10AM and the concierge checked our bags for us since it was too early for check in and were not available yet. Then he suggested a walking tour that we could take of Chinatown and North Beach which was an easy walk and was way better than waiting for check in time.
review.positiveRemarks: location, free wifi, complimentary morning coffee,tea & juice set up in the hallway of our floor, and evening tea and sherry in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is a half block from Union Square. Shopping, Restaurants, Tix Booth & trolley stops are all around the square. Lively area day and night.

review.title: Very Nice!!!

review.title: Old school charm

review.title: Charming hotel
review.reviewText: Kensington Park Hotel is a lovely, well maintained hotel. It may be old, but it is also charming, clean, warm, and conveniently located. I would definitely stay there again, and highly recommend it to both tourist and business travellers.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind

review.title: Unique and comfortable

I would highly recommend for anyone to stay here.

review.title: Average

review.title: Great hotel

The only thing that surprised me was there was no breakfast except coffee, tea and orange juice. For people who get up early it's not convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast - there isn't any
review.locationRemarks: very easy to find and easy to get around

review.title: Great overall hotel
review.reviewText:
Greeted very warmly when checking in. Room was very clean and comfortable. My only negatives had to do with the window being single panes. Allowed for much of the ambient city noise to be heard. Couldn't find a heat setting on the thermostat. Other than these two very minor issues, I loved it.

(Ps, the comforter was very warm)
review.locationRemarks: 1/2 a block from Union Square

review.title: Great long weekend get-a-way.

Sip a little sherry at 5 PM in the lobby and meet some very interesting people. Small, homey feel. We loved it for our 4 day vacation in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Older, but detailed ornamentation in the lobby. Love seat in the elevator.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.

review.title: Very nice hotel and close to Union Square!
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at the Kensington Park Hotel. The location is very close to Union Square and all the shopping, the entire staff was very friendly and the room was clean and well appointed. The morning coffee and juice in the hallway was appreciated as well as the evening sherry. We will definitely stay there again.

review.title: review

Best hotel near Union and convention centre.
It is on a quiet street, within stepping distance of union.
Good range of rooms.

review.title: The Best Sleep I Ever Have
review.reviewText: There is nowhere I sleep better than at Kensington Park (even at home). There's some voodoo going on there, because I'm a very light sleeper.

review.title: lovely experience

I really enjoyed staying at the Kensington Hotel. The location, staff and atmosphere
made me feel very much at home. The fresh water in the lobby was a great amenity.
review.positiveRemarks: The homey feeling...great linen, bathroom, lemon water, location

review.title: Great for a couple in the city!
review.reviewText:
The rooms were pretty nice overall, but the bathrooms are left over from an update in the 1980s. Everything worked well, was very clean, and the staff were all superb. They are on par with any of the five star hotels that I have stayed at worldwide.

There was a big wedding at the hotel and we never even heard a noise form all of the festivities.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi was barely usable in our room.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of downtown. All sorts of good stuff nearby without needing a car.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: I stayed for two nights. I didn't spend much time at the hotel but the time I did spend there was enjoyable. The staff was friendly and the rooms and rest of the hotel was clean. I didn't have much of a view since I had and inside room but it didn't matter since I was only there to sleep. It was in a good location. I would go back.
review.locationRemarks: Great for shopping.

review.title: Business Stay

review.positiveRemarks: Perfect location, view and great customer service

review.title: Great staff and location for couples.

review.negativeRemarks: Toilet
review.locationRemarks: Right in the thick of San Francisco.

review.title: Relaxing retreat in the center of the city
review.reviewText: Great ambiance and a fantastic location. Friendly and low key. Rooms are very quiet and the beds are super comfy!

review.title: Clean, comfortable, secure.
review.reviewText: My husband and I chose this hotel as we needed to stay centrally, and liked its comparatively small size. Our king room was spacious, clean, rear facing (i.e. no traffic noise) and on the 8th floor (i.e. high enough to have a view - we reckon that lower floors might look at a wall). Wifi in the room was free of charge. Service staff seemed to be security conscious, which was reassuring. There was a humming noise from a service duct/pipe, that would bother only the extremely noise sensitve, but no noise from neighbouring rooms.

review.title: Older Hotel with Updates
review.reviewText: Nice room. Older hotel with updates. Rooms in hotel are numbers sequentially (1 - 99) so Room 76 was on the 11th floor. Check the plack by the elevator to see what floor your room is on. Updated bathroom with larger shower and pedistal sink is a little tight for 2 people. Additional mirror over desk. Complimentary coffee and orange juice offered each morning on select floors. Breakfast Cafe a few doors down. Great view of Nob Hill from our window.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location. Room view of Nob Hill. Internet access. Lamps with outlets for charging and connecting. Friendly staff.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and Shopping and Powell-Hyde Cable Car. Many restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Will stay there again
review.reviewText:
I will definitely stay there again. My only complaints are minor:

- Poor quality TV signal
- Free wifi wanted to have you sign in every hour (annoying)
- One of the power outlets looked broken

But this hotel is in a great location (next to Union Square), in a beautiful historic building, staff were great and very friendly, and the room comfortable and nicely done.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi wanted you to sign in every hour
review.locationRemarks: Next to Union Square, a short walk from Bart station

review.title: Great place to stay

review.title: Good location in San Fran.

review.title: Wonderful weekend get away

review.title: Great location

review.title: 5 stat staff

Great hotal, was a pleasure to stay. Hotal rooms are very lovely to say in and very clean, decor was very unique and classy. Location was perfect, just round the corner from union square. Staff were very friendly and helpful, conceriage was helpful in providing us great places to eat and drink in the city. Conceriage was brilliant in obtaing medical service for a friend who needed to see a doctor ASAP. He contacted a travel doctor and sent us to the hospital.

Great service, great hotal, great location, great staff, great beds!!

review.title: A surprise, but a good one.

Our room was clean and comfortable, some of the furnishings had seen better days. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. It is only a block away from Union Square. Overall I loved it and would be happy to stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location close to restaurants and shopping.. Always felt safe.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Bed could be better quality. It was just on for me. Good location.

review.title: Happy days
review.reviewText: The hotel was far better than we expected reading previous reviews.the only down side was the noise from functions in Union Square and that has little to do with the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Great place to stay with at conference
review.reviewText: I stayed for 4 nights during a conference and was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Excellent location just off Union Square and an easy 10 minute walk to the Moscone Conference Centrer. Room was tidy and well appointed. I liked the fact it is more a boutique hotel and felt much more friendly that the large chain hotels.
review.positiveRemarks: The old English feel - they serve complimentary Sherry at 5pm each night and have a coffee maker in the rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: No breakfast facilities in the hotel but plenty of nearby cafes.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to Union Square and a reasonable walk to the Moscone conference center.

review.title: Good for business traveler
review.reviewText: I liked that it was not so huge and impersonal like some o f the other hotels in downtown San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown and within walking distance of everything I needed

review.title: Great Hotel for everyone!!
review.reviewText: We love the location, so close to Union Square, I would definately stay in a King Room we were on 6th floor in room 20, nice size room close to stairs and elevator. Our friends had a queen room and they wished they had a bigger room. We stay here everytime we come to SF and we just love the hotel!!
review.negativeRemarks: I have none
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for Theatre, Dining and SHOPPING!!

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Over all it was great, staff was wonderful, the rooms were nice and very clean. It is an older hotel and with that comes the thicker walls which afford a quieter stay, that is a huge bonus. Only critisism was that when we arrived, they told us they were over booked and tried to send us to another hotel, I did not appreceate that but when we spoke to them, they accomodated us and got us the room. I understand there are a lot of sources that are used to book rooms at hotels but there needs to be a better way so that customers are not displaced once they arive. With that said, I will most definatly come back to this hotel and stay.
review.negativeRemarks: showing up and being informed that the hotel was over booked and they tried to get us to go to another "Sister" hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Great locates, quick taxi ride to everything we wanted to do

review.title: Decent Hotel
review.reviewText: Decent hotel. Kind of on the old side but still maintained and cared for. Rooms were on the small side but were still OK. Great location near Union Square and plenty of restaurants. Friendly and efficient staff and the price was reasonable for boutique type hotel. Would stay there again and would recommend to friends.

review.title: Classy Old Hotel

review.title: Warm and welcoming staff
review.reviewText: My experience of this hotel was positively impacted by the sincere welcome and genuine helpfulness of the hotel staff, from the front desk to concierge to parking attendant to the gentleman who was polishing the brass in the elevator. Thank you...I would return because of the quality of service.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, service and the bed!
review.negativeRemarks: the bathroom...limited counterspace, sink and countertop seemed lower than usual
