review.title: Wonderful get-away in central San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Great location. Very friendly staff from desk clerks to cleaning staff. Comfortable beds. Quality design.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for shopping, cable cars, short walk to restaurants, etc.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at Kensington Park. Our room was clean and comfortable. The staff was courteous and helpful. We loved the location!!

review.title: Friendly and. Grat location
review.reviewText: Very welcoming! Great location. Enjoyed the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Great location in Union Square

review.title: Which Floor?
review.reviewText: Overall great experience, great location and an easy intimate setting. We stayed for two days and loved the feel of the hotel. Our only complaint was that the day we arrived, one of the two elevators was out of order. This is not typically an issue as we were on the 7th floor and happily took the stairs up and down. I did find it frustrating that while the guests sometimes waited for the elevator, the hotel cleaning staff were using the elevator instead of walking. Granted the elevators were large enough to have a beautiful sofa inside, just kind of seems like a no brainer that they would use the stairs to leave the elevator open for guests.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Union Square but peaceful and intimate

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Didn't get the room we reserved, got stuck with 2 double beds versus 1 queen or king. Seemed to be clean and not too outdated. If you want TV channel selections, pick another hotel. Right at Union Square and only 4-5 blocks from BART.
review.negativeRemarks: Double bed and only a few tv channels

review.title: A great bargain
review.reviewText: The room was bigger than expected and very comfortable, with good quality linens and a cozy throw. The bathroom was the only spot the hotel showed its age with old fixtures but strong water pressure. The hotel itself was quiet but sleeping with the window open (no AC) was surprisingly noisy given the busy street below. The only drawback to the location is its proximity to the Tenderloin neighborhood, which limited touristy walking around at night.

review.title: Older but charming
review.reviewText: Kensington Park is in an older building that lacks insulation so that sound travels easily. The building has its charms and is well maintained overall. The location is excellent and staff are friendly and helpful. With Union Square a half block away and easy access to both cable car and F Street trolleys, this hotel is a great base for a visit to San Francisco. Excellent choices for dining, including Fino, are within blocks.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of sound insulation.
review.locationRemarks: Within blocks of Union Square's amazing shops, gates of Chinatown and fine restaurants. A half block from the Powell Street cable car.

review.title: Families with children
review.reviewText: For a family traveling with children, the room was very small but clean. It would be nice if they catered to children more. I would like to see children's television programs offered within the channels to choose from. Also, it would be nice to have kid friendly snacks and drinks offered in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Great location! Very close to Union Square

review.title: Would recommend to any one, such easy access
review.reviewText: What a lovely hotel, so conviently placed for all sightseeing, the staff were so helpful and encouraging and always available to help.
review.positiveRemarks: Reception staff, and the bed, soooooooooooooo comfortable!

review.title: nice place to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a perfect location. The rooms are small but you are not on a vacation if you are staying in your room. The only down fall is no swimming pool for kids. I would recommended this hotel to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: no pool
review.locationRemarks: awesome location. everything within walking distance.

review.title: Kensington Park Hotel, San Fran, Cali
review.reviewText:
Great hotel in the heart of San Francisco. Close to lots of shopping. But with this comes the noise of a busy downtown. Even at night, eight stories up, the noise was enough of a nuisance to cause problems getting to sleep.

Other than that, the hotel was great. Super friendly staff, awesome vintage decor throughout the hotel (except the rooms, which were updated to a fresh modern twist), and a lively atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise levels
review.locationRemarks: Close to lots of good food and shopping

review.title: Had a great time!
review.reviewText: Had the best time in San Francisco and staying at Kensington Park added to the spectacular experience. All the staff were great and treated my mother I so well. We appreciate the kindness of the staff. Will stay again for sure!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff are friendly and the location.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good, so close to Macy's and Walgreens. Enjoyed walking to get my morning latte at a coffee shop. The tea service was enjoyed by my mom.

review.title: Recommend
review.reviewText: Super nice location and nice staff. I heard on review before like they lock the door after 12 but that didn't happen. I did hear the door sound but other than that it was very quiet and nice. Parking is around 36 after tax per day. We stayed there for 3 nights and 4 days but they didn't charge it for the last day so I guess it's fair enough.

review.title: Great safe clean place to stay!
review.reviewText: I thought the Hotel was beautiful and Staff was awesome-extremely helpful. My only complaint is the lack of air circulation/ventilation in bedroom. It got very stuffy and uncomfortable at night. But overall, lovely hotel and great location!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, good location, and very helpful staff
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Perfectly nice.
review.reviewText: The hotel is a grand old lady and in a great location. Service was very nice. The room was perfectly adequate in size, contrary to other reports I read. The bathroom, however, needs help. The vanity and commode were so low that anyone over 5 ft tall would have trouble using them. The windows need sheers over them so you can open the drapes without having a completely bare window staring back, allowing either bright sun or neighboring lookers in.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, and back view of Nob Hill.
review.negativeRemarks: the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: great for downtown

review.title: Ideal location, warm & charming
review.reviewText:
This was a perfect choice for a solo woman traveler. The hotel is a 1/2 blk from Union Square (the shopping area), walking to the Powell Street Station for the BART & muni train and in the midst of lots of great restaurants.

The room itself was very clean, comfortable and well laid out. Free wi-fi & coffee maker. Great water pressure in the shower, huge bathroom mirror. Lots of storage space in the large closet and plenty of drawers. I always felt safe in the hotel and the surrounding area. Tours will pickup/drop off right at the front door. The staff here are exceptionally friendly, helpful and accommodating. It definitely is top of the class for a 3 star hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: I much prefer staying in older but well maintained hotels that have retained their charm and character just like the Kensington Park.
review.negativeRemarks: A safe in the room would have been handy, though they will lock things up for you at reception.
review.locationRemarks: The KP is close to everything, I can't think of a better location for someone visiting SF and taking in the sites.

review.title: GREAT Location!
review.reviewText: Great service by the staff and informative on things to do while their in town. Hotel was nice and great location in relation to all attractions in town. Bed was comfortable, bathroom was nice, and space was nice. If your a person who isn't going to be spending your whole vacation in the hotel room, but want a nice room to come back to and relax in great choice here.

review.title: Better than the price reflects
review.reviewText: I was in town for a convention and found this hotel about a 15 minutes walk from the Moscone Center. I was a bit hesitant because it was signifianctly less expensive than the hotels recommended by the convention organizers, but upon my arrival I was very pleased. They server complimentary tea, lemonade and sherry upon check-in and the cleanliness of the hotel was superb. My room was spacious and offered all the amenities that I needed. My wife had just stayed at the Westin St. Francis, the hotel across the street, the previous week and paid more than twice what I paid and didn't get anything better. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.
review.negativeRemarks: I couldn't open up the window all the way, but this was a security feature after all.
review.locationRemarks: A block away from Union Square and close enough to Moscone Center

review.title: from Irvine, California
review.reviewText: Perfect location, nicely priced. Small, but clean. Service was superb. I would stay again anytime! Visit Fino's italian restaurant while you are there.... perfect restaurant for a perfect vacation!

review.title: Great Experience for the Price
review.reviewText: Like others may have mentioned, the rooms were absolutely tiny, but the service, cleanliness, and atmosphere overall was fantastic. The staff was friendly and helpful from the get-go. I would stay there again. The only things that I didn't necessarily like was that it seems the hotel's main doors are locked after midnight, so guests who stay out later must ring the bell and wait for a staff member to let you in. Also did not like the duvet cover that was on the bed. It was furry, dusty, and looked like a dead animal. One word of advice to the hotel would be to get rid of them ASAP!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff's friendliness & tea and sherry everyday.
review.negativeRemarks: Horrible covers and lockdown at midnight.
review.locationRemarks: Great location--right by Union Square. Very safe, very vibrant.

review.title: SF lux
review.reviewText: Stayed for my last night of a CA trip. Second time staying at Kensington Park and I love it. Ultra comfort, quality service, fantastically nice staff (even the janitors go out of their way to have actual conversation with you), and name recognition that I now expect. Rubin, my concierge, was fantastic. There's a reason I stayed at Kensington a second time and a reason why I'll be back for visits three, four, and five.
review.locationRemarks: relatively dead area for tourists, but great for business and to get in/out of the city

review.title: Lovely older hotel with many advantages
review.reviewText: The Kensington Park is a wonderful hotel for seeing San Francisco. It is half a block from Union Square and an easy walk to the Powell Street Bart Station. The staff is very courteous and friendly, and the hotel is charming and well kept. It has the glamour of old San Francisco, with sherry and tea in the lobby every afternoon for guests. The free wifi in the room works well, the room was very clean, and the shower was great also. I did have some very minor issues, and brought none to the attention of the staff as I personally didn't feel the need. I mention them only for those who might find them more of a problem than I did. First, I could not get the control for the heater to turn the heat down, so the room was very warm unless I kept the window open. Since the weather was lovely (no rain) and the room was located high enough that no one could come in the room that way, I adjusted the room temperature via the window. Second, if you plan on having to spend any time in the room watching TV, don't bother; there are limited, which means no, interesting channels unless you want to pay for movies. Finally, the bed is very very firm, and while I like firm beds, by the end of my four night stay, I was wishing for a little more give in that mattress. But I would definitely stay there again as long as I wasn't staying longer than the four nights.
review.negativeRemarks: terrible TV channels, very firm mattress
review.locationRemarks: Can't go wrong! A half block from Union Square on the quieter side, away from the more touristy area, but still an easy walk to BART, muni, and cabs

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Excellent.... Very nice people, I would recommend this hotel, I will be back....
review.negativeRemarks: A little bit small rooms, however it was not a problem
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: SF Kensington Park
review.reviewText: A great location right next to Union Square and lots of restaurants. The staff was helpful and their answers to questions were correct. The room was a tight squeeze for 4, but that is to be expected in an older urban hotel.

review.title: Will stay here again
review.reviewText: Great location. Loved staying here. Room was a little small for the three of us (I was travelling with my wife and 2 year old son) but we did not spend much time in it. Location was close to union square without the noise, which we loved. Room and bathroom was very clean and staff were very helpful in assisting us with bags, organising taxi's, using hotel amenities, advising on tourist activities etc. I would love to return and stay there again one day. Arrived back to the hotel one afternoon to find a jazz pianist playing in the lobby, which was unexpected and fabulous.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location location. Hotel was very clean. Staff were very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a tiny bit small. Water pressure in the shower was not strong but this was not a big issue.
review.locationRemarks: Just near union square shops with easy cable car access. Located in a quieter position than other hotels.

review.title: Not bad at all
review.reviewText: Hotel was an older style. Good size room and good location. Staff were nice. Overall a pleasent stay. Only complaint doors slam pretty loud and pigeons were annoying in the morning.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the white bed frame. The hotel didnt seem too busy so check in and out was quick. Also liked the bench in the elevator.
review.negativeRemarks: Doors slam really loud. Building is old needs a make over. New carpet would be nice and newer bathrooms.
review.locationRemarks: Location is good. Close to the cabin cars yet not too close where you can hear them. Close to many restaurants, Walgreens and shops.

review.title: Kensington Park Hotel review
review.reviewText: The style of the Kensington Park Hotel is very pleasing and the entrance foyer is wonderful. The staff are very helpful, and the rooms very clean and comforatble. I was offered an upgrade on arrival, but decided against it. The hotel lacks a bar, but there are plenty within a very short walk of the hotel. Air conditioing might be helpful in summer. The hotel lays on free tea and coffee each morning, but I'd prefer to have it available in my room to brew when I wanted. However the free sherry each evening for residents is a nice touch. This is the second time I've stayed in this hotel, and I'd be happy to return.
review.positiveRemarks: Affordable, good deal right in the centre of things for Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of tea/coffe making facilities in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Slap bang on Union Square right in the centre of everything, yet just off the cable car line. Ideal for the Moscone Centre, a 5-10 minute walk away.

review.title: Turn of the century charmer!
review.reviewText:
Hotel has a turn of the century charm about it. The decor is a modern twist on early 20th century furniture. The bed was fabulous! Bathroom was not a charming as bedroom, however the shower was a nice size.

The employees were very pleasant. They accommodated us with a very late check-in at around midnight and kept our bags when we checked-out. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to tourists visiting San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was fabulous. Location was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Television channel selection left a lot to be desired.
review.locationRemarks: Right off Union Square, close to cable car and shopping. About 4-5 blocks from BART.

review.title: Great Hotel in Great Location
review.reviewText: Great hotel and ammentities, rooms are very clean and tidy with very good beds. Great location with good bars and clubs within walking distance. The only negative I would have for this hotel is that the rooms are very small, we had the 2 x deluxe doubles and there wasn't much room to move.
review.locationRemarks: Where Kensington Park is located is the right area to be in especially if you want to check out some good bars and clubs

review.title: OK hotel, great location
review.reviewText: The hotel has not aged well, but the location is great and if the price is right go!

review.title: Great location "but"
review.reviewText: Location excellent. Staff very helpful. Had room in the front very noisy starting at 5:00am. Enough room for the three of us and luggage. Bathroom needed updating as the fake marble was porous and the black in the holes was definitely mold. Drink and water machines were always empty. Coffee and tea served on two floors only so if you were not on those two floors !!!! No running out in your pj's. Hot water was a problem on our last day. But in all fairness the city was doing work and the water was off in the middle of the night so probably didn't have enough time to warm up. I would stay again if I knew things had been updated as the location was excellent for access to great shopping and easy access to all modes of transportation.
review.locationRemarks: North Beach This Italian section had the most amazing restaurants with great value for your $$$$. The Stinking Rose was excellent. Would go there again for sure. If you like canolli go to Stella's bakery. Quaint little bakery where you get wonderful pastries and good coffee or tea.

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: The staff was consistently courteous and helpful. THe hotel is quiet beautiful in an old-fashioned way. It is clean and quiet. Only two complaints; Need better reading lights in the rooms and the bed was sometimes hard to negotiate and I could not figure out why. Best: They have 24-hour free computer availability.
review.locationRemarks: Most of SF--it is a beautiful city.

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: I stayed here for 3 nights after a conference. The staff and particularly the concierge Ruben were unusually helpful and made my stay wonderful.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Have stayed here numerous times, always great accommodations.

review.title: Perfect Location for San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Kensington Park Hotel is located right on Union Square on the Powell Cable Car lines. The location was very convenient to major tourist attractions and the accomodations were clean and comfortable.

review.title: O.K. Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed for 2 nights in this hotel. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. However, I did not sleep well because of the noise coming from the street. The desk clerk said it was probably just the street cleaner - to me it sounded like construction was going on all night right under my window. Also, just 2 blocks away there are people in the street who said they were homeless - kinda scary for a girl from the midwest.
review.locationRemarks: Be sure to stay North and towards the East of Union Square. Not near as many homeless in the streets.

review.title: Hotel with a Personal Touch in a Great Location
review.reviewText: I really wanted my sister & friend to enjoy their accommodation and when I read the reviews it sounded like the place to stay. It was beyond my expectations. We all loved it and were sad to leave. Loved the old style boutique feel it had. Staff were so nice and obliging. Room very clean and comfortable. Beds and linen were top - so comfy, looked and felt so warm and cosy. Location the best. Would definitely stay there again when in SF and no hesitation in recommending same.

review.title: Will definitely go back
review.reviewText: Location is excellent, within walking distance to good restaurants and shopping and transit. You can shop and go back to the hotel to drop off or change then go back out again. Room is small but has everything. The bathroom is new, clean, the beds are new and comfortable. No complaints at all. Just like the reviews said, we got on the BART from the airport and got off at Powell station, walked 2 blocks up to the hotel, extremely convenient. Staff were helpful, friendly and gave good recommendations on tours and restaurant choices.

review.title: small but beautiful
review.reviewText: We loved the Kensignton Park hotel. Front desk staff were extremelly nice and helpfull and organised a town car to take us to the airport as it would be more convineant than a cab. The rooms were quite small though as we had four girls sharing one room with two "queen" beds that felt a bit squishy. Decor and interior was lovely and the lobby was absolutely beautiful. No room service but it's in a great location so it wasn't a major drama.

review.title: Personality by name and by nature
review.reviewText:
This hotel ticked all the boxes necessary for a great stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the location was great, the hotel had a certain charm that made the stay feel special and unique.
They gave us a back room which had a very interesting view of the city high rises but at the same time was relatively quiet considering the location.
Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. I can highly recommend it.

review.title: Hotel to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: It's not a 5-star hotel but it exceeded my expectations. The staff were really nice and hospitable. There was no room service but they readily gave us delivery brochures when asked. They also even checked out the nearby clubs (Ruby Skype) where we could head to in the night. The room was clean and there was free wireless internet. It was a good experience in Kensington Park Hotel. Oh and it is located in town so it was convenient for my friend and I to explore around.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Friendly, helpful staff. Rooms roomy, clean and comfortable. Location great!

review.title: Fun Place!
review.reviewText: Nice room, perfect service, great location, can walk right into the Farralon Restaurant!

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText: Great location. Starbucks around the corner. Easy access to cable cars and buses. We were able to walk to the ferry building in 15 minutes for a shuttle tour we booked and cable cars at the ferry building were good transportation to fisher mans wharf. I traveler with my 75 year old mother and she thought the beds were heaven. Very comfortable.

review.title: I Left My Heart at the Kensington Park San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Stayed there a few years ago when I was a teenager and did not forget it. Things have not changed and are still outstanding! Most comfortable beds in the world and right next door to Union Square. There was an event in Union Square one night and the noise was a bit much, but stopped exactly at midnight. Bathroom was super clean, housekeeping staff were very nice and prompt. Remember, this is a big city, don't complain about space. Rooms are small.
After a long day, we were excited to come back and relax here.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: The hotel was unique--had an Elks Club and a theater inside. Sherry in the afternoon was a nice touch, but the hotel did not serve coffee in the morning, only tea. Decor was fun. Our room was small for three people (2 double beds). Location was very good; easy access to public transporation and right in the middle of a large shopping area.

review.title: Kensington Park Hotel is the best!
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Kensington Park Hotel on our anniversary was terrific. The treated us like royalty. We will diffidently return the next time we visit San Francisco. Great staff and a super location too.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
Great location. The staff is very kind and always there to help.
The building is historic... at some point the carpets at the halls need probably some renovation but the lobby is OK and the bedrooms -most important thing - are very good, spacious, clean and comfortable.
There is no restaurant but they have complementary coffee and tea every morning and afternoon. Coffee shop next door (literally) is a good place to have breakfast anyway.
It's right on Union Square. Location is ideal for shopping also.
At the same street there are great sushi restaurants, so we had everything we needed.
There's a 35 USD daily fee per valet parking but considering other parking fees and the good price of the hotel, total was a fair price.
This is a hotel I'd definitely recommend.

review.title: Pefect location in San Francisco...it is my hotel of choice always!
review.reviewText: Always a great location and small hotel...I keep going back as it is my "home" when I go to the City!

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText:
Free wireless, very friendly staff, clean and nice rooms --
Absolutely superb shower --
We came in the morning and they let us check in early!
The only reason I can't give it an absolutely perfect score is that the coffee service in the morning, though adequate, was not tremendous -- too small cups with no place to sit. . .
But overall -- really good experience. . .

review.title: Kensington Park review Union Square SFO Jan-11
review.reviewText:
Hotel is very convenitnetly located for the centre of San Francisco, and in my case just a few blocks from Moscone Centre. Room was well appointed, but lacked tea/coffee making facilities. Tea & coffee were available in hotel from 7-10am, but not much good when you awake at 4am with jet lag. Only a small gripe in the great scheme of things. Tea and sherry served daily in early evening in lobby.
Lack of Air con fine in January, but may be an issue in Summer.

review.title: kebinsv
review.reviewText:
An old quaint hotel ideally situated in San Francisco - close to the trolleys, Union Square, local shops and restaurants.
The only down was the Concierge - he was not very helpful.
Does not have a restaurant, but reception was able to direct us to nearby excellent reataurants.

review.title: Kensington Park Is Fantastic.
review.reviewText: Staying at this hotel is a fantastic experience. Staff is courteous and friendly. Rooms are comfortable. Location, near Union Square, is great.

review.title: Pleasant stay, very convenient location
review.reviewText: Upon arrival there was a picket protest happening outside, and the front facade of the hotel was scaffolded and in the midst of renovation (this wasn't mentioned prior to booking). However the entire stay was pleasant, although nothing really stood out. Staff were friendly enough and service was good. The location was very convenient and for the price paid, was good value.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText:
First-timers in San Francisco. We stayed 5 days and couln't had chosen a better location in the city. The hotel is close to everything, atractions, cable car, shopping.
The women marathon started right on the door of the hotel which was an interesting experience.

review.title: Location, location, location! Perfectly situated.
review.reviewText: The staff were wonderful in all regards. The hotel was spotless. The bed was comfortable. Every major store was a skip, hop, or jump away. Riding the cable cars that passed right at the corner, was a real San Francisco delight. Highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: wonderful location-small well maintained fresh rooms
review.reviewText: This hotel is right off union square, very convient to every thing. Service was good, very clean.. If you belomg to the ELK's, they have a very good lodge in this very building, which they own. it is very worth while to tour the lodge and have a drink at their fabulous bar. Tour the city on an open air bus. It was great

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: I walked into a very charming lobby with extremely friendly staff. They were all very attentive to my needs and questions. I was given a map of San Francisco to help me get around easily and was given several suggestions of where to eat for a reasonable amount of money. The location of the hotel is very convenient to all attractions in San Francisco, the trolley cars, buses and taxis. Plus it's in a location that you can walk to many places also. I will definitely stay here again when I make my trips to San Francisco for my work.

review.title: Historic hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText:
The Kensington is wonderfully located to Union Square, one block away. Great restaurant and shopping location. We walked everywhere! Loved it.
Trolley and busses are almost right outside the front door. Front desk and concierge were extremely helpful and pleasant. Sherry was served for guests after 4:00 pm..very nice touch. Nice to sit in historic lobby and relax after a day of sightseeing. Our room was a smaller room but still had more than enough space for luggage and things. There was a dresser, desk, night tables and couple chairs. Bathroom was very clean, marble floors. When the hotel was renovated they installed polished brass fixtures which are now showing their age such as the brass trim on the shower doors, handles and towel bars. Everything was still very clean. Our bed was very comfortable, lots of pillows and down comforter. The weather was quite warm when we were there. The windows open and there is a ceiling fan which we used all night. I was surprised, coming from Ohio, that there were no screens on the windows....no bugs either! We had a lovely stay and would recommend to anyone.

review.title: We will recomend this Hotel.
review.reviewText: Very happy with this hotel. We were upgraded when we arrived. The staff were really friendly. We had coffee each morning on our floor just 2 doors down. Pretty good coffee too! The hotel is 1/2 a block from Union Square which can't be beat. We would most certainly stay here again and would recommend this hotel to friends and family. We would also consider any of the other hotels that are a part of the personalty hotels.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Great location, rooms were fantastic! In particular, the beds were sooo comfortable!

review.title: Great hotel for the price; excellent location
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and the room was very comfortable. There is no AC in this hotel, but you can open the windows and they have ceiling fans in the rooms. This made the room quite comfortable during our stay, when the temperatures were in the high 70's during they day and the mid-50's at night. The bed was really comfortable and the toiletries were excellent (Terre Pure). There were a closet with lots of hangers, a spacious dresser, two side tables, and a desk in the room. The only thing I felt we were missing was bathrobes. Other than the comfortable beds, the best thing about the hotel is the location. It's less than one block to Union Square and it's very close (walking distance) to many of the tourist attractions in SF. It's also about 2-3 blocks to the metro stop and about 1 block to the cable car stop. There are numerous restaurants/cafes and lots of shopping in the area, too. The room was a reasonable size for SF. Overall, we were satisfied and would consider staying here again if the price and weather were similar.

review.title: Overall it's ok, but I will not stay there again.
review.reviewText: Convenient location.

review.title: Dissappointing experience
review.reviewText: The staff was polite and accommodating but the stay was not pleasant. Lots of loud noise at all hours. Loud obnoxious 'Jerry Springer' guests having outbursts. Threadbare linens. See Trip Ad***or review.

review.title: What a personality.
review.reviewText: Location, location, location. You can't beat the location. Not all hotels were created equal. Kensington is right next to union square and you can find all the shopping, restaurants, etc with a short walk. Be careful not to walk beyond the mapped areas of union square unless you are used to the ghetto with drug dealers, trannies, and homeless drunks. The room we got was on the fifth floor and the window is next to a YMCA or something. We had to close the curtains most of the time so no perv could watch our intimate moments. Otherwise, we had a terrific time there at Kensington.

review.title: Very confortable and charming.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. The room was small but very clean and comfortable.The staff was helpful and friendly. Good location for shopping at the major stores They did provide coffee and tea at the 9th floor, but we were disappointed it did not offer a continental breakfast , as our previous hotel had. Overall it was a very pleasant stay .

review.title: Our favorite hotel in S.F.
review.reviewText: We love the hotel and its location. The staff always goes out their way to make us feel welcome and feel at home.

review.title: can't wait to go back; will stay there again!!!
review.reviewText: great price, we were there mid march. Found great rate through internet special.

review.title: Great value and location!
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location - just around the corner from Ruby Skye's as that is where we were headed that night! We only stayed one night but it was a nice cozy, clean room and the decor was nice. If we ever want to take a mini trip into the City for the weekend, we'd stay there again.

review.title: best location for shopping and a taste of city life
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel located in heart of San Francisco. Just steps from Union Square shopping. Perfect if you're flying into the city and don't have a car. Rooms are on the small side but beautifully decorated and impeccably clean. All the modern amenities. Staff are friendly and helpful. Feels like a four or five star hotel. Great location for theatre and night life. Lots of restaurants in the area that stay open late. Have stayed at this hotel three times and would not hesitate to go back. I can afford to stay in a more expensive hotel but always choose Kensington Park because of its great location, service and style. Great place for a girlfriend's getaway.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel with historic lobby and elevator. Beds were great and decor was very nice. Small room but the attention to detail in the decor made up for it. Coffee in the morning and sherry in the afternoon was free. Great location - walking distance to all the shopping around Union Square and China Town. Hotel staff were helpful and very nice. Very close to cable car stop and double decker tour bus stop. Convenient, comfortable, and cozy luxury.

review.title: close to Union Square but no facilities at all, just a bedroom/bathroom
review.reviewText: Good hotel if all you need is a bed and bathroom close to Union Square. Hotel has no atmosphere, no bar, restaurant at all, not even a minibar in the room and room are quite small and noisy. For the money, better to stay at Fisherman's wharf.Parking fees are astronomical !

review.title: Pleasant, but does this place actually have a manager?
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, and our room was comfortable and very nicely decorated. The location is great, half a block off Union Square. Unforatunately, when we showered on the firt morning, we realized that the tub drain was so slow that we were standing in six inches of water. Despite calling on a daily basis, the problem was never fixed. Additionally, we three times requested to speak with the hotel manager, and were told that he would call us back....and he never bothered. Quite a disappointment. Stay somewhere else, where they actually value your patronage enough to follow through with returning calls and ensuring that your room meets basic standards.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, clean room, great restaurant, perfect location

review.title: No complaints - Great Hotel - Great Location
review.reviewText: We stayed a week Sept 20-27 2009 at the Kensington Park Hotel. Great Hotel, no complaints. We booked we arrived at the hotel at noon and was immediately upgraded to a king suite and given access to our room straight away. We were travelling with our 7 year old daughter, they provided us with a rollaway bed, no charge. Each morning her bed was made with her beloved stuffies placed strategically on her pillow and her "can't be without" blanky folded neatly at the foot of her bed. Every afternoon it was a rush for her to get back to the room to see what positions her animals where left in. Highlight of her trip. The hotel is in an awesome location close to cable car, buses and right at Union Square. Couldn't have picked a better place. Staff very knowledgeable and extremely helpful. Would go back there any day.

review.title: Very cozy and comfortable
review.reviewText: Great location. Relatively quiet and cozy in the heart of San Francisco.

review.title: C lassy little hotel
review.reviewText: My friend and I stayed at this hotel in mid September. We felt very safe and welcome at the Kensington Park. The staff was alert and ready to help with any questions. We certainly will go back to the Kensington next time.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I took my 17 year old son to SF for short vacation. The best part of Kensington Park is the location. It is very central. Union Sq and all the shopping is within a couple blocks. We walked to the Embarcadaro, Fishermans Wharf, Coit Tower, Lombard St, AT&T Park, Chinatown, Haight and Ashbury and Golden Gate Park. Not all in one day, but if you like to walk the location is perfect. You can also catch Bart,Trolley, city bus or a Street car without a problem. The noise of the hotel door closing is very annoying. Every time someone opens the door and it closes you can hear it. No good lighting in the bathrooms, but water pressure in shower is great. I liked that we could open our bedroom window for fresh air. And if you want to relax and watch TV in the evening you only have a few stations.

review.title: Charmed!
review.reviewText: Im a boutique hotel fan and this hotel meets all my needs in this category.. From the elevators to the bathrooms, this small hotel is very very lovely...

review.title: Great for the price
review.reviewText: I stayed in the KP for 3 nights and was happy with the quality of the linens, the appointments in the room and the general decor. However, I had one of the worst room locations possible. My room looked out across a small alley into the window of the Elks lodge (which is also located, in part, in the hotel's building). This meant I had to keep the curtains drawn pretty much all the time. Second, the room was located direct across the hall from the maids' supply closet... which acts as a hub of conversation for the maid staff and thus creates noise at about 8am. Despite these downsides (which are fairly specific to my room) I liked the hotel and it was of a good quality and in a good location. Make sure to ask for a higher room to avoid staring into another window.

review.title: Not worth the price
review.reviewText: No service, no minibar,no safe in the room,no friendly staff, no roomservice after 16 p.m, only a nice no english speaking bellboy.We went on the same trip we went to las vegas The Venetian and new York Carlton on Madison.We had a suite and a superbe room for the same price at the Kensington with excellent services.Very disappointed, we are very frequent travelers all over the world never made a commentary but this time we had to do it.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Our window was broken and we couldn't shut it completly. Only one electric outlet worked near the bed so I was forced to chose between my CPAP machine and the light on the bedstand. Room otherwise was fine and quiet.

review.title: great value at Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is unpretentious, but clean and comfortable. It was a great value at a great location.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel for the price. Located right next to Union Square. Parking a bit expensive at the hotel, but there is a self parking garage right around the corner. Clean rooms, helpful staff, and great location in SF.

review.title: Lovely Stay
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, very cute and comfortable. Only downside was the noise...could always hear doors slamming and noise from the street. A different room location could have solved the street noise problem, not sure about the doors. They don't have the mechanism on them that slows them when shutting, so they really do slam. Otherwise, would definitely recommend. Great hotel for the price!

review.title: Would go back in a heartbeat!
review.reviewText: Kensington Park Hotel has so much charm! The pictures were quite right when showing the place! The price is so affordable for the luxury you get! It was WELL worth the price! Front desk staff was always so very sweet and helpful. The rooms were quiet, charming, updated, stylish, with the most amazing bed that we have EVER slept in...(like every review has said! They were right!) We have no doubts about coming back to Kensington Park Hotel!

review.title: Great Customer Service
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with this hotel. When we checked in the Front Desk staff was outstanding. They actually introduced themselves and said if there was anything we needed to ask for them. The hotel itself is older but well kept up and the location is excellent. Only a few steps from Union Square and the cable car stop. Will definetly stay here again!

review.title: Fabulous place to stay
review.reviewText: Very close to Union square Interesting boutique hotel with personailty and charm. Beds very comfortable Room overlooking nob hill very quiet Early morning coffee very pleasant Reasonable tariffs

review.title: perfect location
review.reviewText: Perfect location for leisure or business, right next to Union Square. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but clean. Coffee and tea available in the morning, sherry and tea in the afternoon. Valet service is expensive, but worthwhile.

review.title: perfect place to be in the shopping district.
review.reviewText: Pros: great old architecture, capable staff, clean, close to all shops and after hour liquor stores, fantastic restaurant right next door, afternoon tea or sherry in the lobby! Cons: ice rooms only on floors 9 & 11, don't have a continental breakfast/coffee on location, no A/C

review.title: Quite Charming
review.reviewText: I loved it. For a first time visitor, the location is great, centrally located.

review.title: Very cute boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, very conveniently located in Union Square. Close to many restaurants, shopping and Muni and Bart stops. 10 minute walk to Chinatown.

review.title: Friendly, Attentive Hotel Staff, Great Hotel Location
review.reviewText: This was the first trip to San Francisco for myself and my husband, so we were not sure if our choice of hotel would be a good one. We were pleasantly surprised with the courteous, attentive staff you could find at all hours of the day or night. Our room was very clean, nicely decorated and the king size bed was very comfortable. The hotel is situated in Union Square, which is a great central location. No car is needed. You can easily take the BART from the airport and walk a short 6 blocks from the train station, to the hotel. You can hop on a Trolly car, cable car, or bus all within a block or two distance from the hotel. Any one of these modes of transportation can get you to the various attractions, including Fisherman's Wharf. We look forward to another visit to this hotel in the near future.

review.title: Highly Recommend
review.reviewText: First time visit to San Fran. I highly recommend the Kensington Park Hotel - rooms a bit small, but clean, comfortable and GREAT bed. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Classy old hotel.

review.title: Great location, if a bit noisy street side
review.reviewText: The best thing about this hotel is its great location--close to everything in Union Square and the cable car lines. It's a bit noisy if you have a room along either Powell or Post street (which would be true of any hotel in the Square); but we requested a switch after our first night, and they were more than happy to move us to an interior room.

review.title: Would have liked to have stayed longer
review.reviewText: We do a shopping/show trip in the City a couple times a year and like to stay at boutique hotels that still leave money left to shop with! The Kensington fit the bill perfectly. The staff was wonderful, the location is perfect and the beds are AMAZING! We look forward to returning!

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Would thoroughly recommend this hotel. It is central and well maintained, with helpful staff. We would certainly stay here again.

review.title: Great room
review.reviewText: The room was just rignt, not too large or too small. One of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on. The location was perfect, within walking distance from Union Square (across from Saks Fifth Avenue!). I'll definitely return.

review.title: Great weekend escape....
review.reviewText: This place was great! I had a double the first night and my guest was only there for one night and the hotel needed the double room, so they upgraded me to King Suite for my second night. Only wish rooms had a mini-bar...

review.title: Charming Hotel
review.reviewText: A wonderful period hotel located in the heart of bustling San Francisco only minutes from Union Square.The room was comfortable and clean.

review.title: Somewhere Different
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel to stay in central San Fran - its only a minute from Union Square, the staff are friendly and helpful, its clean, comfortable, there's free wireless internet in the rooms and lobby and although there is no restaurant in the hotel (i.e. no breakfast) there's a good cafe next door that does room service.Last of all it has a bit of character i.e. not the standard room /architecture you get in business hotels.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was wonderful. Also enjoyed the fitness center at their sister hotel.

review.title: Great Choice
review.reviewText: I was traveling with my Mom and my sister. I researched and chose the Kensington because all three of us like old world charm and character. We were not disappointed, the staff was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. We enjoyed the warmly decorated rooms and lobby. Upon returning from a long day of tours or exploring we walked thru the door and felt that "it's good to be home" feeling. The lobby sitting areas felt personal and not so grand that you felt like a visitor. The decor and furnishings in the room were soothing to the eye. The shower was great and invigorating and those down comforters were hard to leave behind. The hotel's central location was wonderful.. we easily made our way around to all the city has to offer. I know we all plan a trip back to SF and when we do I know we will choose to go to our home away from home at the Kensington!

review.title: Terrific Plan - but Beware of Parking
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel and was disappointed when we left due to the over 40 minutes it took to get our car. We ended up being late for a reservationn and subsequent cancellation. They will tell you to call 20 minutes before; however, if it is a Sunday - call an hour before and have the car waiting outside. They were very apologetic and explained they were having problems with the car service, but that doesn't make it better when you are late for a reservation. Coffee already made on the 9th floor is an added treat.

review.title: Will be back
review.reviewText: Great location. Really nice staff. No wireless internet in room, but there is dial up service in the room. The hotel exceeded my expectations and I will return.

review.title: Quaint boutique hotel in the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: This hotel was in the perfect location in Union Square. We walked everywhere, including to Fisherman's Wharf from here. Although there is no restaurant in the hotel, they provide tea & coffee in the morning and sherry in the late afternoon. The hotel was a nice change from the usual chain hotels. There is a theatre right in the hotel which is handy if you plan to see a show. My only complaint was the old, musty smell in our bedroom. We kept the ceiling fan on and it helped get rid of it.

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: great hotel. Centrally located. staff extremely helpful. Rooms may be considered small for some, but typical of large cities.

review.title: A hotel with personality
review.reviewText: This small central hotel is ideally situated for exploring San Fransisco, and for the financial and business districts. The welcome is friendly with free "tea or sherry" available for guests every evening, which sets the tone. This is not really a hotel for young children. The rooms are clean and well equipped though perhaps not quite as spacious as some in USA. The staff are attentive to all problems. The decor is quirky, with a lot of original features preserved. Most impressive of all is the Victorian theatre within the building, still in regular use, which occupies the 2nd -4th floors, with rooms above. It is still in regular use. there is no restaraunt, and the hotel does not serve breakfast, but with a host of diners within a block this is not a problem. Overall a delightful place to stay at reasonable prices for the location and quality.

review.title: Liked our stay
review.reviewText: Great price to be in the middle of everything....clean room slightly smaller but perfect for the on the go trip. Decor pleases the eye....would recommend stay

review.title: Great location and nice room
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Kensington Park and would highly recommend it to travelers. The hotel is centrally located in Union Square and it is very easy to get anywhere in the city. The staff was very helpful and we can't wait to go back again.

review.title: Our stay at the Kensington Park Hotel
review.reviewText: Great value in SF, well located, clean and fairly quiet; on the ball personel. Close to a BART station.

review.title: Good location, good rates
review.reviewText: The hotel met our expectations. The only drawback was the lack of PBS stations on the TV. The room was small, but adequate, and the amenities were OK but minimal.

review.title: Nice small hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is a small older property. It is well located near Union Square, near shopping venues and with easy access to mass transit for venturing out into the city. The room was small but well maintained and the beds were comfortable. Free wifi in the room was nice and free morning coffee was good as was afternoon tea & sherry in the lobby. Overall, a good value for San Francisco hotels, particularly those located downtown.

review.title: Hotel Kensington Park, San Fransisco
review.reviewText: This hotel has plenty of charachter. The staff were extremely helpful when after the first night we requested to be moved to a room at the rear of the hotel where it was a lot quieter of night. They even pointed out that the view from the rear rooms was not as nice as the from the front. Ideally and centrally located for the first time visitor to SF. Fifty yard walk to Union Square.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is very reasonably priced, especially considering it's right in the middle of all the action. You can hop on the cable car half a block away, or walk to all the placed in Union Square. The hotel itself is well maintained, and the beds are comfortable. Will definitely stay here again when I come back to San Francisco.

review.title: FANTASTIC VALUE IN UNION SQUARE BRILLANT LOCATION
review.reviewText: We stayed in the Kensington Park hotel from 7th September to the 13th for our honeymoon we were upgraded to a king bed and found it to be fantastic value for money and a brillant location right on union square right next to hotels costing double what we paid with expedia. The one negative point was the usual san francisco night noise which im sure is somewhat due to the old thin windows but i would recommend due to the cheap price and excellent location.

review.title: Busines Trip
review.reviewText: Great location, the only thing was the theatre crowd but otherwise fine

review.title: Revived Old Beauty - Comfortable
review.reviewText: My recent stay at the KP was comfortable in the high heat of Labor Day Weekend. True, the room didn't have air conditioning, but it wasn't stuffy. Miracle considering that it was 90 degrees outside. The hotel lobby was beautiful - check out the lovely ceiling. The paintings are wonderful and the old-style feel is nice. The staff are quite friendly and helpful. Note: There are no in-room safes and you cannot give a laptop to the front desk. Just keep this in mind, the safe-keeping boxes are small. They can accept small things like jewelry. Also, the valet service is a 3rd party, which parks offsite. The desk asks that you give them 20 minutes to retrieve your vehicle. The valet was pretty quick in my experience, not taking more than 10 minutes to get my car. I strongly suggest not having a car, unless you drive in to the city like I did. Public Transport in SF is fantastic - coverage, price and convenience. SF transit does it right.

review.title: I'd return
review.reviewText: I like this restored old hotel. The rooms have high ceilings and windows. It's colse to everything.

review.title: The only down note on our stay..... Valet parking... takes too long to retrieve car.
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff and truly lovely hotel... Sherry and Tea time a pleansant treat before going out for the evening... Excellant location... walking distance to the Theatre district and wonderful place to eat and shop...

review.title: Room was a little small. No Air Conditioning. Service Excellent
review.reviewText: Beautiful Hotel & well restored.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: nice friendly small hotel located next to union square.Service very good, manager even let me use his personal e mail as I had trouble with my own.Concierge very helpful organised hire car for us leaving San Francico. Rooms nice and clean.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Stayed here before. Great location on Union Square. Clean, nice staff, rooms comfortable and nice. Had to ask for a refridge...but staff said they are coming to all rooms soon. Overall, great value, would go back in a heartbeat!

review.title: No complaints
review.reviewText: I've stayed at Kensington a couple times, and I'm kind of surprised that you can get such a good place for a good price right in Union Square. It's got a definite touch of class, the rooms are spacious compared to the peer-group (the bathroom is very upscale), and it's so close to everything in the Union Square area. I don't think I'll be staying around the square anymore, though; I like the area, but the panhandling is out of control- you get hit on about 20 times a block. It's demoralizing. I spent some time in Calcutta once, and I can't say for sure which is worse.

review.title: A blast from the past
review.reviewText: This hotel was built by the Elks in the 20's. It's amenities are aimed primarily at the Elk's, that is, a private bar and lodge on the 3rd floor. No breakfast room or room service for guests. The desk clerks were quite helpful. Through Expedia the price was right. The wireless connection worked perfectly.

review.title: Unresponsive
review.reviewText: During my stay both elevators were inoperable for nearly 8 hours one afternoon/evening. Unbelievable! I had to climb 160 steps to reach my room on two occasions. Others, (elderly couple and pregnant lady were left to suffer on ground floor). No apologies or even a bottle of water the next day to say "I'm sorry for the inconvenience." Rooms were clean. I'm still stunned at the indifference of management.

review.title: Filthy Room
review.reviewText: Bed bug, hair in tub, stained comforter, something under bed I don't even want to describe, shampoos half used. Checked in at 1 am and had no other place to go or wouldn't have stayed there. Horrid.

review.title: Stay here every chance we get,.
review.reviewText: The entire staff is extremely competent and helpful. Everyone from the manager, to the reception, maids, bell captain and even maintainence very helpful and friendly

review.title: Fabulous hotel with loads of charm
review.reviewText: My family had a tremendous stay. Everyone we encountered at the hotel was friendly and polite. They were eager to help us in seeing the sights of San Francisco. Our room was very comfortable and always cleaned up early in the day. The hotel itself is beautiful. My daughters enjoyed sitting down while riding the elevator. The location of the hotel could not have better. We were able to jump on the cable car within minutes from leaving the hotel. The next time we are in San Francisco we will stay at the Kensington Park Hotel. Thank you.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Extremely cosy and superior location. Certainly worth the price!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is a idealy located to Union Square, shopping and China Town. The staff was courteous and very helpful. But I thought the hotel lobby and our room to be very dark and somwhat dingy.

review.title: A Great Hotel Find Near Union Square!
review.reviewText: I have stayed in enough San Francisco hotels over the past 40 years to know the difference in prices, locations, service etc. and cannot recommend the Kensington Park highly enough. Compared to other Union Square properties, this hotel offers personalized service, comfortable & spacious rooms, and a staff that acts like they truly care about the needs of their guests. The only minor problem involved the vallet parking process and the scarcity of loading spaces during busy weekend times. If one is not driving a car into the city and is interested in being close to all the downtown attractions, this is the perfect place to stay.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Tons of Character, very cute. Great Location!!

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: For the price the Kensington was fine. A little old and could use some updating. Small rooms but fine if you're basically just sleeping there. Perfect location for the Union Square area. Tons of restaurants, bars and a great Blues club (Biscuit n Blues) nearby. Good buy for the money.

review.title: Very nice place, but warm
review.reviewText: Very classy, quiet hotel for the price. My only complaints would be that I got a room with windows facing the handball court across the roof(smoker room, I guess), and there was no A/C- very warm with no air circulation; A/C not really necessary, but a fan would make all the difference.

review.title: I'm Impressed
review.reviewText: I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends. Union Square is just a few steps away.

review.title: Excellent Price/Location Value
review.reviewText: A boutique of faded elegance, The Kensington Park provides excellent value for those seeking a minimum service hostelry in a superior location at a reasonable price. Many properties claim a "Union Square" address, but the Kensington really is just a half a block from the Square on a sreet that is safe, clean, interesting and accessible. My fourposter bed took up most of the room, but the view was unexpectedly expansive.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: great location at union square, cable cars, and shopping. On the second floor of the hotel, the "Spelling Bee" broadway show is playing now.

review.title: Nice place, well located
review.reviewText: Very nice people, smart hotel that aims to please. Excellent value.

review.title: Lovely hotel in downtown
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfect: location, cleanliness, service. If only it had double glazed windows. You could sometimes hear the noize from the road work at 4am... Some of you may feel the room a little bit too small. I felt cozy though.

review.title: Classy hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Staff were helpful. Room was spacious. Classic style. Excellent location to Union Square.
